original: dgongs pa ni 'di yin te /

original: ming dang gzugs la brten pa'i dbang po rnams ni skye mched drug go //
analyzed: ming dang gzugs la brten pa'i dbang po rnams ni skye mched drug go //
translated: The faculties that are based on name-and-form are the six sense bases.

original: chos gsum 'dus pa ni reg pa'o //
analyzed: chos gsum 'dus pa ni reg pa'o //
translated: The coming together of the three is contact.

original: reg pa myong ba ni tshor ba'o //
analyzed: reg pa myong ba ni tshor ba'o //
translated: The experience of contact is feeling.

original: tshor ba la zhen pa ni sred pa'o //
analyzed: tshor ba la zhen pa ni sred pa'o //
translated: Clinging to feelings is craving.

original: sred pa 'phel ba ni len pa'o //
analyzed: sred pa 'phel ba ni len pa'o //
translated: The increase of craving is grasping.

original: len pa las skyes pa yang srid pa skyes pa'i las ni srid pa'o //
analyzed: len pa las skyes pa yang srid pa skyes pa'i las ni srid pa'o //
translated: Karma that is produced from grasping and that produces a new existence is becoming.

original: rgyu de las phung po byung ba ni skye ba'o //
analyzed: rgyu de las phung po byung ba ni skye ba'o //
translated: The arising of the aggregates from that cause is birth.

original: skyes nas phung po smin pa ni rgas pa'o //
analyzed: skyes nas phung po smin pa ni rgas pa'o //
translated: The maturation of the aggregates that have arisen is old age.

original: rgas nas phung po 'jig pa ni 'chi ba'o //
analyzed: rgas nas phung po 'jig pa ni 'chi ba'o //
translated: The destruction of the aggregates that have matured is death.

original: 'chi zhing myong ste mngon par chags pa dang bcas pa'i nang gi yongs su gdung ba ni mya ngan no //
analyzed: 'chi zhing myong ste mngon par chags pa dang bcas pa'i nang gi yongs su gdung ba ni mya ngan no //
translated: Sorrow is the internal burning of one who is attached to the dying and the experienced.

original: mya ngan las byung ba'i tshig tu smra ba ni smre sngags 'don pa'o //
analyzed: mya ngan las byung ba'i tshig tu smra ba ni smre sngags 'don pa'o //
translated: Lamentation is the expression of sorrow in words.

original: rnam par shes pa lnga'i tshogs dang ldan pa'i mi bde ba myong ba ni sdug bsngal myong ba'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa lnga'i tshogs dang ldan pa'i mi bde ba myong ba ni sdug bsngal myong ba'o //
translated: The experience of pain associated with the five collections of consciousness is suffering.

original: yid la byed pa dang ldan pa'i yid kyi sdug bsngal ni yid mi bde ba'o //
analyzed: yid la byed pa dang ldan pa'i yid kyi sdug bsngal ni yid mi bde ba'o //
translated: Mental suffering associated with mental activity is sorrow.

original: gzhan yang 'di lta bu la sogs pa nyon mongs pa @202b gang yin pa ni 'khrug pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang 'di lta bu la sogs pa nyon mongs pa @202b gang yin pa ni 'khrug pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Moreover, all the afflictions such as these are called ‚Äúdisturbance.‚Äù

original: de la mun pa chen po'i phyir ma rig pa'o //
analyzed: de la mun pa chen po'i phyir ma rig pa'o //
translated: It is called ignorance because it is a great darkness.

original: mngon par 'du byed pa'i phyir 'du byed rnams so //
analyzed: mngon par 'du byed pa'i phyir 'du byed rnams so //
translated: It is called the formations because they form the future existence.

original: rnam par rig pa'i phyir rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par rig pa'i phyir rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: It is called consciousness because it is conscious of objects.

original: rlom pa'i phyir ming dang gzugs so //
analyzed: rlom pa'i phyir ming dang gzugs so //
translated: It is called name-and-form because of the pride of name-and-form.

original: skye ba'i sgo'i phyir skye mched drug go //
analyzed: skye ba'i sgo'i phyir skye mched drug go //
translated: It is called the six sense bases because they are the doors of entry into existence.

original: reg pa'i don gyis reg pa'o ;
analyzed: reg pa'i don gyis reg pa'o ;
translated: It is called contact because it is the meeting of the three.

original: / myong ba'i phyir tshor ba'o //
analyzed: / myong ba'i phyir tshor ba'o //
translated: It is called feeling because it feels the object.

original: skom pa'i phyir sred pa'o //
analyzed: skom pa'i phyir sred pa'o //
translated: It is called craving because it thirsts for the object.

original: nye bar len pa'i phyir len pa'o //üîΩyang srid pa skyed pa'i phyir srid pa'o //
analyzed: nye bar len pa'i phyir len pa'o // yang srid pa skyed pa'i phyir srid pa'o //
translated: It is called grasping because it grasps the object.üîΩIt is called becoming because it produces the next existence.

original: phung po 'byung ba'i phyir skye ba'o //
analyzed: phung po 'byung ba'i phyir skye ba'o //
translated: It is called birth because the aggregates come into existence.

original: phung po smin pa'i phyir rgas pa'o //
analyzed: phung po smin pa'i phyir rgas pa'o //
translated: It is called aging because the aggregates mature.

original: 'jig pa'i phyir 'chi ba'o //
analyzed: 'jig pa'i phyir 'chi ba'o //
translated: It is called death because there is a breaking up.

original: mya ngan byed pa'i phyir mya ngan no //
analyzed: mya ngan byed pa'i phyir mya ngan no //
translated: It is called sorrow because one grieves.

original: tshig gi smre ba'i phyir smre sngags 'don pa'o //üîΩlus la gnod pa'i phyir sdug bsngal pa'o //
analyzed: tshig gi smre ba'i phyir smre sngags 'don pa'o // lus la gnod pa'i phyir sdug bsngal pa'o //
translated: It is called lamentation because one cries out.üîΩIt is called pain because there is physical discomfort.

original: sems la gnod pa'i phyir yid mi bde ba'o //
analyzed: sems la gnod pa'i phyir yid mi bde ba'o //
translated: It is called suffering because there is mental discomfort.

original: nyon mongs pa'i phyir 'khrug pa'o zhes rgyas par gsungs so //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i phyir 'khrug pa'o zhes rgyas par gsungs so //
translated: because of the defilements, there is conflict.

original: de ltar nye bar bstan pa'i rkyen rnams rgyun ma chad na 'du byed nyams pa med par 'jug ste /
analyzed: de ltar nye bar bstan pa'i rkyen rnams rgyun ma chad na 'du byed nyams pa med par 'jug ste /
translated: Thus, as long as the conditions that have been indicated are not interrupted, the formations continue without interruption.

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba yan lag bcu gnyis po de nyid 'du byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba yan lag bcu gnyis po de nyid 'du byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And it is precisely the twelve members of dependent origination that are the formations.

original: slob dpon gyi zhal snga nas /
analyzed: slob dpon gyi zhal snga nas /
translated: The Master has said:

original: ji ltar 'bangs bzhin rim gyis rgyun //
analyzed: ji ltar 'bangs bzhin rim gyis rgyun //
translated: Like a stream, they arise in sequence.

original: skyes nas las dang nyon mongs kyis //
analyzed: skyes nas las dang nyon mongs kyis //
translated: Having arisen, through action and defilement,

original: 'jig rten pha rol dag tu 'gro //
analyzed: 'jig rten pha rol dag tu 'gro //
translated: one goes to another world.

original: srid pa'i 'khor lo thog ma med //üîΩde ni rten cing 'brel 'byung ba'i //
analyzed: srid pa'i 'khor lo thog ma med // de ni rten cing 'brel 'byung ba'i //
translated: The wheel of existence has no beginning.üîΩIt is the twelve members of dependent origination,

original: yan lag bcu gnyis cha gsum mo //üîΩzhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: yan lag bcu gnyis cha gsum mo // zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: divided into three parts.

original: rkyen rnams yang rgyun chad na rnam pa thams cad du 'khor ba med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: rkyen rnams yang rgyun chad na rnam pa thams cad du 'khor ba med par 'gyur te /
translated: If the conditions are interrupted, there is no cycle of existence in any way,

original: rgyu ma tshang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu ma tshang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the cause is incomplete.

original: de'i phyir sangs rgyas kyang 'khor bar thal bar 'gyur ba de ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir sangs rgyas kyang 'khor bar thal bar 'gyur ba de ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not the case that it follows that even the Buddha would be in the cycle of existence.

original: de ltar re zhig mdo sde pa la sogs pa'i brgal ba bsal nas /
analyzed: de ltar re zhig mdo sde pa la sogs pa'i brgal ba bsal nas /
translated: Thus, having cleared away the objections of the Sutra Followers and so forth,

original: rnal 'byor spyod pa'i log par rtog pa bsal ba'i chad du de'i lugs kyi nyes pa brjod pa ni /
analyzed: rnal 'byor spyod pa'i log par rtog pa bsal ba'i chad du de'i lugs kyi nyes pa brjod pa ni /
translated: in order to clear away the misconceptions of the Yogacaras, the faults of their system are expressed.

original: gang tshe 'khrul pa zhes pa la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gang tshe 'khrul pa zhes pa la sogs pa smos te /
translated: When all is delusion, etc.

original: gang gi tshe dbu mar smra ba rnams kyis 'gro ba thams cad sgyu ma'i bdag nyid kyi rang bzhin gyis stong par khas blangs pa na phyi rol bzhin du sgyu ma'i rang bzhin kun rdzob 'dzin par byed pa'i blo yang khyed la yod pa ma yin la /
analyzed: gang gi tshe dbu mar smra ba rnams kyis 'gro ba thams cad sgyu ma'i bdag nyid kyi rang bzhin gyis stong par khas blangs pa na phyi rol bzhin du sgyu ma'i rang bzhin kun rdzob 'dzin par byed pa'i blo yang khyed la yod pa ma yin la /
translated: When the Madhyamikas accept that all transmigrating beings are empty of a nature that is an illusion-like entity, then, like external things, the mind that apprehends the illusion-like nature of the relative does not exist for you.

original: de'i tshe sgyu ma gang gis dmigs par 'gyur te /üîΩgang gis rtogs par 'gyur te 'dzin pa dngos po yod pa'i shes pa ma gtogs @203a * //
analyzed: de'i tshe sgyu ma gang gis dmigs par 'gyur te / gang gis rtogs par 'gyur te 'dzin pa dngos po yod pa'i shes pa ma gtogs @203a * //
translated: At that time, by whom is the illusion observed?

original: pa cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin no zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: pa cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin no zhes pa'i don to //
translated: By whom is it realized? The meaning is that there is not the slightest existence of a consciousness that is an apprehender, an entity that exists.

original: gang gi yang rang gi sems nyid don dam par yod pa ma yin la /
analyzed: gang gi yang rang gi sems nyid don dam par yod pa ma yin la /
translated: And for you, the mind itself does not ultimately exist.

original: phyi rol gyi rang bzhin nyid kyi 'khrul pas de bzhin du snang ste /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi rang bzhin nyid kyi 'khrul pas de bzhin du snang ste /
translated: The error of external reality appears in that way.

original: de la ni nyes pa yod pa ma yin no zhes pa ni bsams pa'o //
analyzed: de la ni nyes pa yod pa ma yin no zhes pa ni bsams pa'o //
translated: The thought is that there is no fault in that.

original: de lta bu bsal ba'i don du gang tshe khyod la zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /üîΩglang pa la sogs pa'i rnam par 'jug pas gzung bar bya ba nyid kyis gang gi tshe sgyu ma nyid khyod de /üîΩrnam par shes par smra ba khyed cag la yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta bu bsal ba'i don du gang tshe khyod la zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te / glang pa la sogs pa'i rnam par 'jug pas gzung bar bya ba nyid kyis gang gi tshe sgyu ma nyid khyod de / rnam par shes par smra ba khyed cag la yod pa ma yin te /
translated: In order to dispel that, he says, ‚ÄúWhen for you, etc.‚Äù

original: 'gro ba sems tsam du khas len pas phyi rol gyi don med pa'i phyir de'i tshe ci zhig dmigs te /
analyzed: 'gro ba sems tsam du khas len pas phyi rol gyi don med pa'i phyir de'i tshe ci zhig dmigs te /
translated: When, by the engagement of the aspect of an elephant, etc., it is apprehended, then, for you, the proponents of consciousness, there is no illusion, because you accept that the world is mind only, and external objects do not exist.üîΩWhat is perceived then?

original: de'i tshe 'dir ci zhig snang bar 'gyur /
analyzed: de'i tshe 'dir ci zhig snang bar 'gyur /
translated: What appears here then?

original: phyi rol gyi don med pa'i phyir yul la sogs par rnam par chad pa'i snang ba rigs pa ma yin no zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi don med pa'i phyir yul la sogs par rnam par chad pa'i snang ba rigs pa ma yin no zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that, because there are no external objects, the appearance as a division into objects, etc., is not reasonable.

original: de la gzhan gyi bsam pa'i dogs pas gal te dngos por zhen pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de la gzhan gyi bsam pa'i dogs pas gal te dngos por zhen pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: In this regard, he says, ‚ÄúIf you are attached to things, etc.,‚Äù because of the suspicion of another‚Äôs thought.

original: rang gi sems nyid 'khrul pas phyi rol gyi gzugs nyid du glang po che la sogs pa'i rnam par snang ba yin no zhes gsungs so zhe na /
analyzed: rang gi sems nyid 'khrul pas phyi rol gyi gzugs nyid du glang po che la sogs pa'i rnam par snang ba yin no zhes gsungs so zhe na /
translated: The mind itself is deluded, and it appears in the aspect of an elephant and so on as an external form.

original: gsungs pa nyid yin te 'on kyang sems nyid rnam par shes pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: gsungs pa nyid yin te 'on kyang sems nyid rnam par shes pa nyid yin te /
translated: This is stated, but it is the mind itself that is consciousness.

original: de ni zhes pa ni yul la sogs pa chad par gzung bar bya ba nyid kyis rab tu snang ba dang ldan pa yin la /
analyzed: de ni zhes pa ni yul la sogs pa chad par gzung bar bya ba nyid kyis rab tu snang ba dang ldan pa yin la /
translated: That is to say, it is the object and so on that is apprehended as a division, and it is endowed with the appearance of that.

original: rnam pa ni snang ba yin te /
analyzed: rnam pa ni snang ba yin te /
translated: The aspect is the appearance.

original: gzhan zhes pa ni nang gi 'dzin pa'i sems kyi rnam pa gzhan yin la /
analyzed: gzhan zhes pa ni nang gi 'dzin pa'i sems kyi rnam pa gzhan yin la /
translated: Other means the other aspect of the internal apprehending mind.üîΩExistence is possession, the thing that is reality.

original: yod pa ni bdog pa ste de kho na nyid kyi dngos po yin la gal te yang zhes pa ni khas blangs pa brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: yod pa ni bdog pa ste de kho na nyid kyi dngos po yin la gal te yang zhes pa ni khas blangs pa brjod pa yin te /
translated: If also means stating an acceptance.üîΩEven so, this is not a connection.

original: de lta na yang 'di ni 'brel pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de lta na yang 'di ni 'brel pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate this, it is said:

original: gang tshe sems nyid sgyu ma ni //
analyzed: gang tshe sems nyid sgyu ma ni //
translated: When the mind itself is an illusion

original: zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: and so on.

original: sems nyid rnam par shes pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: sems nyid rnam par shes pa nyid yin te /
translated: The mind itself is consciousness.

original: rig par byed pa po nyid du khas blangs pa yin la gang gi tshe sgyu ma las gzhan ma yin pa'i rig pa po sems las tha dad pa snga ma zhes bya ba 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rig par byed pa po nyid du khas blangs pa yin la gang gi tshe sgyu ma las gzhan ma yin pa'i rig pa po sems las tha dad pa snga ma zhes bya ba 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: The mind is accepted as the very one who knows. But when there is no knower other than the illusion, no mind that is different from the mind, then there is no prior knower.

original: de'i bdag nyid yin pas de de ltar snang ba khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid yin pas de de ltar snang ba khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is of the nature of that, it is accepted that it appears in that way.

original: de tshe gang zhig gang gis mthong //
analyzed: de tshe gang zhig gang gis mthong //
translated: Then who sees what?

original: zhes te / gang zhig gang gis rtogs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: zhes te / gang zhig gang gis rtogs par 'gyur te /
translated: Who understands what?

original: mthong ba nyid 'ba' zhig yod kyi mthong bar bya ba ni med la /
analyzed: mthong ba nyid 'ba' zhig yod kyi mthong bar bya ba ni med la /
translated: Only seeing exists, but the seen does not exist.

original: mthong bar bya ba med par mthong ba yang yod pa ma yin te de ni mthong bar bya @203b ba la ltos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mthong bar bya ba med par mthong ba yang yod pa ma yin te de ni mthong bar bya @203b ba la ltos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And without the seen, seeing does not exist, because it depends on the seen.

original: de'i phyir gang gis cung zad kyang mthong ba ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir gang gis cung zad kyang mthong ba ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, nothing is seen at all.

original: de lta bas na 'gro ba mtha' dag long ba nyid thob par 'gyur ro zhes dgongs pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na 'gro ba mtha' dag long ba nyid thob par 'gyur ro zhes dgongs pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the entire world is blind.

original: gal te de ltar gyur na yang gal te shes pa'i bdag nyid myong ba ma yin par 'gyur la /
analyzed: gal te de ltar gyur na yang gal te shes pa'i bdag nyid myong ba ma yin par 'gyur la /
translated: If that were so, then consciousness would not be self-experience.

original: 'on kyang rang rig pa nyid kyis rang gi ngo bo myong ba ni de las tha mi dad pa'i sgyu ma la sogs pa yang rtogs pa yin te /
analyzed: 'on kyang rang rig pa nyid kyis rang gi ngo bo myong ba ni de las tha mi dad pa'i sgyu ma la sogs pa yang rtogs pa yin te /
translated: However, the essence of consciousness is self-experience, and it is also the realization of illusions and so on that are not different from it.üîΩEven if that were so, there would be no loss at all.

original: de ltar gyur na yang cung zad kyang nyams pa med do zhes rnam par shes par smra ba'i bsam pa'i don dam pas gsungs pa /
analyzed: de ltar gyur na yang cung zad kyang nyams pa med do zhes rnam par shes par smra ba'i bsam pa'i don dam pas gsungs pa /
translated: This is the ultimate intention of the Proponents of Consciousness.

original: 'jig rten gyi ni mgon pos kyang //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi ni mgon pos kyang //
translated: The protector of the world

original: zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: taught that all phenomena are like illusions.

original: 'gro ba rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid du gang gi tshe rigs pas bstan pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: 'gro ba rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid du gang gi tshe rigs pas bstan pa de'i tshe /
translated: When it is taught through reasoning that beings are empty by nature,

original: gang gis gang gi rang bzhin gyi dngos po zhes gang zhig gang gis rtogs par 'gyur /
analyzed: gang gis gang gi rang bzhin gyi dngos po zhes gang zhig gang gis rtogs par 'gyur /
translated: then by what and how is anything realized?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis chos thams cad stong pa yin te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis chos thams cad stong pa yin te /
translated: The BhagavƒÅn said, ‚ÄúAll phenomena are empty.

original: stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid sems yin zhing chos thams cad rnam par dben pa dang / rnam par dben pa'i mtshan nyid kyang sems yin no zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid sems yin zhing chos thams cad rnam par dben pa dang / rnam par dben pa'i mtshan nyid kyang sems yin no zhes gsungs so //
translated: The characteristic of emptiness is mind, and the characteristic of the emptiness of all things is also mind.

original: gzhan yang 'jig rten gyi mgon pos kyang gsungs shing bka' stsal pa yin te /
analyzed: gzhan yang 'jig rten gyi mgon pos kyang gsungs shing bka' stsal pa yin te /
translated: Moreover, the Lord of the World has also spoken and taught:

original: 'jig rten ni sems can thams cad yin la /
analyzed: 'jig rten ni sems can thams cad yin la /
translated: The world is all sentient beings.

original: mgon pos zhes pa ni skabs te sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis so //
analyzed: mgon pos zhes pa ni skabs te sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis so //
translated: The Lord is the context, the Buddha, the Blessed One.

original: ci zhig gsungs she na /
analyzed: ci zhig gsungs she na /
translated: What did he say?

original: sems kyis sems mi mthong zhes te /
analyzed: sems kyis sems mi mthong zhes te /
translated: The mind does not see the mind.

original: sems kyi bdag nyid ni sems kyis shes pa ma yin te /
analyzed: sems kyi bdag nyid ni sems kyis shes pa ma yin te /
translated: The nature of the mind is not known by the mind.

original: dngos po de kho na nyid du yod kyang bdag nyid la byed pa 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po de kho na nyid du yod kyang bdag nyid la byed pa 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Although the thing exists in reality, it is contradictory for it to act on itself.

original: ci lta bu zhe na /üîΩral gri'i so ni rang la rang //
analyzed: ci lta bu zhe na / ral gri'i so ni rang la rang //
translated: What is it like?üîΩThe edge of a sword does not cut itself.

original: zhes te / ji ltar shin tu rno ba'i ral gri'i sos gzhan bzhin du bdag nyid de rang gi lus mi gcod cing gcod par mi byed de /
analyzed: zhes te / ji ltar shin tu rno ba'i ral gri'i sos gzhan bzhin du bdag nyid de rang gi lus mi gcod cing gcod par mi byed de /
translated: Just as a very sharp sword does not cut itself, its own body, nor does it make itself cut,

original: bdag nyid la byed pa 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag nyid la byed pa 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is contradictory for something to act on itself.

original: de bzhin du yid kyang ral gri'i so bzhin du bdag nyid kyi sems kyis bdag nyid mi mthong ngo zhes sbyar ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du yid kyang ral gri'i so bzhin du bdag nyid kyi sems kyis bdag nyid mi mthong ngo zhes sbyar ro //
translated: In the same way, the mind is like the edge of a sword: it does not see itself with itself.

original: shes pa gcig po de la rig par bya ba dang rig par byed pa dang / rig pa'i bdag nyid gsum mi rigs te /
analyzed: shes pa gcig po de la rig par bya ba dang rig par byed pa dang / rig pa'i bdag nyid gsum mi rigs te /
translated: It is not tenable that a single cognition has three natures‚Äîthat which is cognized, that which cognizes, and that which has the nature of cognition.

original: cha shas med pa gcig la rang bzhin gsum mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: cha shas med pa gcig la rang bzhin gsum mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not tenable that a single thing without parts has three natures.

original: de la 'di 'phags pa gtsug na rin po che'i mdo las /üîΩde sems kun tu tshol ba na sems nang na yang dag par rjes su mi @204a * //üîΩmthong ; sems phyi rol na yang dag par rjes su mi mthong zhes pa dang / phung po rnams la yang sems yang dag par rjes su mi mthong khams rnams la yang sems yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /
analyzed: de la 'di 'phags pa gtsug na rin po che'i mdo las / de sems kun tu tshol ba na sems nang na yang dag par rjes su mi @204a * // mthong ; sems phyi rol na yang dag par rjes su mi mthong zhes pa dang / phung po rnams la yang sems yang dag par rjes su mi mthong khams rnams la yang sems yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /
translated: In this regard, the noble S≈´tra on the Jewel at the Crown of the Head says,üîΩWhen they search for the mind, they do not see the mind as real either internally or externally.

original: skye mched rnams la yang sems yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: skye mched rnams la yang sems yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: They do not see the mind as real in the aggregates, in the constituents, or in the sense spheres.

original: des sems yang dag par rjes su ma mthong bas /
analyzed: des sems yang dag par rjes su ma mthong bas /
translated: Since he does not see the mind,üîΩhe searches for the mind‚Äôs continuum, thinking,üîΩ‚ÄòFrom what does the mind arise?‚Äô

original: sems gang las byung zhes sems kyi rgyun kun du tshol zhing de 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: sems gang las byung zhes sems kyi rgyun kun du tshol zhing de 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: He thinks,

original: dmigs pa yod pa las sems 'byung bar 'gyur ro snyam mo //
analyzed: dmigs pa yod pa las sems 'byung bar 'gyur ro snyam mo //
translated: ‚ÄòThe mind arises from an object.‚Äô

original: de yang 'di snyam du sems te /üîΩci dmigs pa de yang gzhan la /
analyzed: de yang 'di snyam du sems te / ci dmigs pa de yang gzhan la /
translated: He thinks,

original: sems de yang gzhan nam /
analyzed: sems de yang gzhan nam /
translated: ‚ÄòIs the object one thing and the mind another?

original: 'on te dmigs pa gang yin pa de nyid sems yin /
analyzed: 'on te dmigs pa gang yin pa de nyid sems yin /
translated: Or is the object itself the mind?

original: gal te dmigs pa yang gzhan la sems kyang gzhan na ni sems de gnyis su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te dmigs pa yang gzhan la sems kyang gzhan na ni sems de gnyis su 'gyur ro //
translated: If the object is one thing and the mind another, then there are two minds.

original: 'on te dmigs pa gang yin pa de nyid sems yin na sems kyis sems de ji ltar mthong bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'on te dmigs pa gang yin pa de nyid sems yin na sems kyis sems de ji ltar mthong bar 'gyur te /
translated: But if the object itself is the mind, how can the mind see the mind?

original: sems kyis sems mthong bar mi rung ngo //
analyzed: sems kyis sems mthong bar mi rung ngo //
translated: The mind cannot see the mind.

original: 'di lta ste dper na /
analyzed: 'di lta ste dper na /
translated: It is just like

original: ral gri'i so de nyid kyis ral gri'i so de nyid bcad par mi nus pa dang / sor mo'i rtse mo de nyid kyis sor mo'i rtse mo la reg par mi nus pa de bzhin du sems de nyid kyis sems de nyid mthong bar mi nus so zhes rgyas par gsungs so //
analyzed: ral gri'i so de nyid kyis ral gri'i so de nyid bcad par mi nus pa dang / sor mo'i rtse mo de nyid kyis sor mo'i rtse mo la reg par mi nus pa de bzhin du sems de nyid kyis sems de nyid mthong bar mi nus so zhes rgyas par gsungs so //
translated: Just as the edge of a sword cannot cut itself, and the tip of a finger cannot touch itself, in the same way, the mind cannot see itself.

original: 'dir sems tsam nyid du smra bas rang la byed pa 'gal ba bsal bar 'dod cing rang gi phyogs bsgrub pa'i ched du dpe brjod pa ji ltar mar me zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: 'dir sems tsam nyid du smra bas rang la byed pa 'gal ba bsal bar 'dod cing rang gi phyogs bsgrub pa'i ched du dpe brjod pa ji ltar mar me zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Here, the proponents of mind only, wishing to dispel the contradiction of reflexive awareness and to establish their own position, give the example of a lamp in the line ‚ÄúJust as a lamp illuminates itself and others.‚Äù

original: rang gi dngos ni rang gi rang bzhin yin te /üîΩdper na mar me bzhin du ste mar me ltar yang dag par gsal bar byed cing mngon par byed do //
analyzed: rang gi dngos ni rang gi rang bzhin yin te / dper na mar me bzhin du ste mar me ltar yang dag par gsal bar byed cing mngon par byed do //
translated: ‚ÄúIts own entity‚Äù means its own nature.üîΩJust as a lamp illuminates itself and others,üîΩin the same way, consciousness illuminates itself and others.

original: 'di ltar yang nges pas mun pas bsgribs pa'i bum pa la sogs pa'i dngos po rtogs par bya ba'i ched du mar me 'degs par byed la /
analyzed: 'di ltar yang nges pas mun pas bsgribs pa'i bum pa la sogs pa'i dngos po rtogs par bya ba'i ched du mar me 'degs par byed la /
translated: In this way, a lamp is raised in order to perceive objects such as a pot that are obscured by darkness.

original: de bzhin du mar me gsal bar bya ba'i ched du ni mar me gzhan ma yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du mar me gsal bar bya ba'i ched du ni mar me gzhan ma yin te /
translated: Likewise, it is not another lamp for the sake of illuminating a lamp.

original: 'on kyang bum pa la sogs pa gsal bar byed pa gang yin pa de nyid kyis bdag nyid kyang gsal bar byed la /
analyzed: 'on kyang bum pa la sogs pa gsal bar byed pa gang yin pa de nyid kyis bdag nyid kyang gsal bar byed la /
translated: However, just that which illuminates a pot, etc. illuminates itself.

original: de bzhin du skabs su bab pa'i rang rig pa la yang go bar bya zhing cung zad kyang 'gal ba yod pa ma yin no zhes thams cad du sbyar bar bya ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du skabs su bab pa'i rang rig pa la yang go bar bya zhing cung zad kyang 'gal ba yod pa ma yin no zhes thams cad du sbyar bar bya ste /
translated: And just so, one should understand the present reflexive awareness, and there is not the slightest contradiction. One should apply this in all cases.

original: de lta bas na mar me bzhin du 'gal ba med pa nyid do zhe na /
analyzed: de lta bas na mar me bzhin du 'gal ba med pa nyid do zhe na /
translated: Thus, like a lamp, there is no contradiction.

original: gal te de ltar sems na de'i tshe 'di skad smra bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: gal te de ltar sems na de'i tshe 'di skad smra bar mi bya'o //
translated: If one thinks in this way, then one should not speak in this way.

original: ci'i @204b phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i @204b phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: mar me zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: mar me zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: He says ‚Äúa lamp, etc.‚Äù

original: gsal bar bya ba ma yin pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: gsal bar bya ba ma yin pa nyid yin te /
translated: It is not something to be illuminated.

original: bum pa la sogs pa bzhin du gsal bar bya ba ma yin pa kho na'o //
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa bzhin du gsal bar bya ba ma yin pa kho na'o //
translated: Like a pot, etc., it is not something to be illuminated.

original: gang gi phyir mar me mun gyis bsgribs pa med de mun pas g-yogs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir mar me mun gyis bsgribs pa med de mun pas g-yogs pa ma yin no //
translated: Because a lamp is not obscured by darkness; it is not covered by darkness.

original: sgrib par byed pa yod pa sel ba ni gsal ba yin no //
analyzed: sgrib par byed pa yod pa sel ba ni gsal ba yin no //
translated: Illumination is the removal of that which obscures what exists.

original: de'i phyir bum pa la sogs pa gsal ba ni de rnams sngar yod pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: de'i phyir bum pa la sogs pa gsal ba ni de rnams sngar yod pa'i phyir la /
translated: Therefore, a pot, etc., is illuminated because it exists prior to that.

original: de ltar mar me ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ltar mar me ni ma yin te /
translated: But a lamp is not like that,

original: de sngar med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de sngar med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it does not exist prior to that.

original: med pa yang gsal bar rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: med pa yang gsal bar rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: And it is not tenable that what does not exist is illuminated,

original: med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because it does not exist.

original: de'i phyir 'di ltar mar me ni gsal bar bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di ltar mar me ni gsal bar bya ba ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, a lamp is not illuminated in this way,

original: 'di ltar mi 'dra ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar mi 'dra ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not like that.

original: mar me'i dpes ni bsgrub bya 'grub pa ma yin no //
analyzed: mar me'i dpes ni bsgrub bya 'grub pa ma yin no //
translated: The example of the lamp does not establish the thesis.

original: de ltar gyur na yang ji ltar mar me zhes pa la sogs pas mar me'i bdag nyid gang yin pa ni mun pas bsgribs pa gsal bar byed pa yin no zhes 'di skad du brjod pa ni ma yin la /üîΩ'on kyang de'i rang bzhin gyi dbang du byas te /
analyzed: de ltar gyur na yang ji ltar mar me zhes pa la sogs pas mar me'i bdag nyid gang yin pa ni mun pas bsgribs pa gsal bar byed pa yin no zhes 'di skad du brjod pa ni ma yin la / 'on kyang de'i rang bzhin gyi dbang du byas te /
translated: But in that case, it is not said that the nature of a lamp is to illuminate what is obscured by darkness.

original: gzhan la ltos pa ma yin pa tsam yin no zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan la ltos pa ma yin pa tsam yin no zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: Rather, it is said that it is merely independent of another.

original: 'di nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach this, he says,

original: shel bzhin du zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: shel bzhin du zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Like a crystal, etc.

original: ni zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir te /
analyzed: ni zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir te /
translated: ‚ÄúIndeed‚Äù means ‚Äúbecause.‚Äù

original: ji ltar shel rdo rang bzhin sngon po ma yin par yod pa yon tan sngon po nyid du skyed pa la rgyu mtshan gzhan gyi khyad par 'dab ma sngon po la sogs pa nye ba la ltos la de bzhin du dngos po rang nyid kyis sngon po yin
analyzed: ji ltar shel rdo rang bzhin sngon po ma yin par yod pa yon tan sngon po nyid du skyed pa la rgyu mtshan gzhan gyi khyad par 'dab ma sngon po la sogs pa nye ba la ltos la de bzhin du dngos po rang nyid kyis sngon po yin
translated: Just as a crystal stone, which exists without a blue nature, generates the quality of blueness, depending on the proximity of another particular cause, such as a blue leaf, in the same way, a thing is itself blue.

original: pa de lta na yang sngon po nyid du bya ba la khyad par gzhan la ltos pa ni ma yin no //üîΩde bzhin zhes te rnam pa des bum pa la sogs pa'i dngos po cung zhig mar me la sogs pa gzhan la ltos pas gsal ba mthong la mar me la sogs pa 'ga' zhig yang gzhan la ltos pa ma yin zhing rang nyid gsal ba'i bdag nyid du
analyzed: pa de lta na yang sngon po nyid du bya ba la khyad par gzhan la ltos pa ni ma yin no // de bzhin zhes te rnam pa des bum pa la sogs pa'i dngos po cung zhig mar me la sogs pa gzhan la ltos pas gsal ba mthong la mar me la sogs pa 'ga' zhig yang gzhan la ltos pa ma yin zhing rang nyid gsal ba'i bdag nyid du
translated: Even though it is blue, it does not depend on another particular cause in order to be blue.

original: mthong ste dmigs pa yin la /
analyzed: mthong ste dmigs pa yin la /
translated: ‚ÄúLikewise,‚Äù by that process, one sees that some things, such as a pot, are illuminated by depending on another, such as a lamp. Some things, such as a lamp, are not illuminated by depending on another, but are seen, that is, are observed, to be self-illuminated.

original: 'di tsam nyid brjod par 'dod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di tsam nyid brjod par 'dod pa yin no //
translated: This alone is what is intended to be said.

original: de bzhin du rnam par shes pa tsam du smra bas khyad par brjod pa la ;
analyzed: de bzhin du rnam par shes pa tsam du smra bas khyad par brjod pa la ;
translated: Likewise, the proponents of consciousness only state a distinction:

original: 'grub pa'i mtha' smra bas sngon po nyid re zhig gzhan la ltos pa med par dpe'i sgo nas bstan pa dgag pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'grub pa'i mtha' smra bas sngon po nyid re zhig gzhan la ltos pa med par dpe'i sgo nas bstan pa dgag pa'i phyir /
translated: The proponent of the tenets states that blue itself, without depending on another, is not established by way of an example. In order to refute that, it is said:

original: sngo nyid min la zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: sngo nyid min la zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Blue is not non-blue.

original: dpe 'di yang 'dra ba ma yin te /üîΩgang gi phyir sngon po yang sngon po nyid du byed pa la shel bzhin du gzhan la ma ltos pa @205a * //
analyzed: dpe 'di yang 'dra ba ma yin te / gang gi phyir sngon po yang sngon po nyid du byed pa la shel bzhin du gzhan la ma ltos pa @205a * //
translated: This example is not similar.

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: This is because blue, in order to be blue, does not, like a crystal, not depend on another.

original: de'i ngo bor 'gyur ba la rang gi rgyu dang rkyen la ltos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i ngo bor 'gyur ba la rang gi rgyu dang rkyen la ltos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because in order to become its entity, it depends on its own causes and conditions.

original: 'di yang nam gyi tshe gzhan la ltos pa yod par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: 'di yang nam gyi tshe gzhan la ltos pa yod par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: When does this also come to depend on another?

original: gal te sngon po ma yin pa nyid du rang gi rgyu las skyes na yang der 'gyur ba las gzhan la ma ltos par rang nyid kyi sngon po'i bdag nyid du byed na ste de yang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gal te sngon po ma yin pa nyid du rang gi rgyu las skyes na yang der 'gyur ba las gzhan la ma ltos par rang nyid kyi sngon po'i bdag nyid du byed na ste de yang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: If blue were produced from its cause as not being blue, then it would be blue by itself without depending on anything else. But that does not exist.

original: gang gi phyir sngon po ma yin te sngon po'i yon tan dang bral ba ni ma yin no zhes 'gegs par byed de /
analyzed: gang gi phyir sngon po ma yin te sngon po'i yon tan dang bral ba ni ma yin no zhes 'gegs par byed de /
translated: Because it is not the case that it is not blue, that is, it is not devoid of the property of blueness.

original: de zhes bya ba ni sngon por 'dod pa'i dngos po yin la /
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni sngon por 'dod pa'i dngos po yin la /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthat which‚Äù refers to the entity that is asserted to be blue.

original: sngon po ste sngon po'i yon tan dang ldan pa yin zhing /
analyzed: sngon po ste sngon po'i yon tan dang ldan pa yin zhing /
translated: ‚ÄúBlue‚Äù means possessing the property of blueness.

original: bdag nyid de rang gi ngo bo bdag nyid kyi rang bzhin gyis byed pa ma yin la /
analyzed: bdag nyid de rang gi ngo bo bdag nyid kyi rang bzhin gyis byed pa ma yin la /
translated: ‚ÄúBy itself‚Äù means by its own nature, by its own essence.

original: sngar bzhin du byed par nus pa ma yin te /
analyzed: sngar bzhin du byed par nus pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not able to make itself blue as it was before.

original: bdag nyid la byed pa 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag nyid la byed pa 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is contradictory for something to act on itself.

original: de'i phyir sngon po yang sngon po nyid du byed pa la shel bzhin du gzhan la ma ltos pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir sngon po yang sngon po nyid du byed pa la shel bzhin du gzhan la ma ltos pa ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, just as a crystal does not become blue by itself without depending on something else, blue also does not become blue by itself.

original: 'di ltar shel rdo yang dngos po gnas pa'i ngo bo nyid khyad par gzhan dang nye bas sngon por bsgyur bar gyur ba yin te /üîΩ'on kyang thams cad rang gi nye bar len pa'i skad cig ma dang sngon po'i khyad par lhan cig byed pa'i rkyen las kyang snga ma rang nyid kyis 'gags nas /
analyzed: 'di ltar shel rdo yang dngos po gnas pa'i ngo bo nyid khyad par gzhan dang nye bas sngon por bsgyur bar gyur ba yin te / 'on kyang thams cad rang gi nye bar len pa'i skad cig ma dang sngon po'i khyad par lhan cig byed pa'i rkyen las kyang snga ma rang nyid kyis 'gags nas /
translated: In the same way, a crystal is transformed into blue by the proximity of another entity, the nature of which is to endure.

original: shel rngo sngon po'i yon tan gyis bsgyur ba gzhan nyid skye bar 'gyur ro zhes pa ni grub pa'i mtha' yin no //
analyzed: shel rngo sngon po'i yon tan gyis bsgyur ba gzhan nyid skye bar 'gyur ro zhes pa ni grub pa'i mtha' yin no //
translated: However, the crystal is destroyed by the preceding moment of the crystal itself, and another crystal arises, transformed by the quality of the blue.üîΩThis is our theory.

original: de la yon tan skyed pa la rgyu dang rkyen la rag las par ni 'di dag thun mong nyid yin la /
analyzed: de la yon tan skyed pa la rgyu dang rkyen la rag las par ni 'di dag thun mong nyid yin la /
translated: The production of a quality is common to all qualities.

original: de bzhin du skabs su bab pa'i bsgrub bya la yang khyad par cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du skabs su bab pa'i bsgrub bya la yang khyad par cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: The thesis to be established is not different from this example.

original: 'o na ni mdza' bos yid du 'ong ba bsgrubs pa yin te /
analyzed: 'o na ni mdza' bos yid du 'ong ba bsgrubs pa yin te /
translated: But the friend accomplishes what is agreeable.

original: gang gi phyir rang gi rgyu dang rkyen las bems po'i rang bzhin las bzlog gi bdag nyid du bskyed pa'i shes pa nyid gsal ba gzhan la ma ltos par bdag nyid gsal ba la rang rig par brjod de /
analyzed: gang gi phyir rang gi rgyu dang rkyen las bems po'i rang bzhin las bzlog gi bdag nyid du bskyed pa'i shes pa nyid gsal ba gzhan la ma ltos par bdag nyid gsal ba la rang rig par brjod de /
translated: Because consciousness, which is produced from its own causes and conditions in a nature opposite from that of matter, is itself clear and is not dependent on another to be clear, it is called reflexive awareness.

original: 'di nyid ni kho bos kyang sngon po'i bdag nyid dpyad pas bsgrubs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di nyid ni kho bos kyang sngon po'i bdag nyid dpyad pas bsgrubs pa yin no //
translated: This is also established by the analysis of the nature of blue.

original: 'di tsam nyid kyis mar me yang dper byas pa yin la /
analyzed: 'di tsam nyid kyis mar me yang dper byas pa yin la /
translated: This much alone is the example of the butterlamp.

original: yang kho bo cag rnams kyis las dang byed pa po dang bya ba tha dad pas shes pa'i bdag nyid gsal bar ni yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: yang kho bo cag rnams kyis las dang byed pa po dang bya ba tha dad pas shes pa'i bdag nyid gsal bar ni yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Moreover, since the agent, object, and action are different, the clear nature of consciousness does not exist.

original: yod pa gcig la las la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gsum mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yod pa gcig la las la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gsum mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is illogical for a single existent to have three natures such as the object and so on.

original: de bya ba tha dad @205b pa'i sgo nas skyon brjod na yang kho bo ni cung zad kyang sun phyung ba ma yin te /
analyzed: de bya ba tha dad @205b pa'i sgo nas skyon brjod na yang kho bo ni cung zad kyang sun phyung ba ma yin te /
translated: If you object that this is faulty because the object and so on are different actions, we are not refuted in the least.

original: rang gi rgyu las skyes pa'i bdag nyid kyi gsal ba ma nyams pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi rgyu las skyes pa'i bdag nyid kyi gsal ba ma nyams pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the clear nature that is produced from its own causes is not impaired.

original: de ltar na bdag nyid rig pa la skyon brjod pas thal ba med do //
analyzed: de ltar na bdag nyid rig pa la skyon brjod pas thal ba med do //
translated: Thus, since the fault is stated in terms of reflexive awareness, the absurd consequence does not follow.

original: de brjod pa /üîΩrnam shes bems po'i rang bzhin las //
analyzed: de brjod pa / rnam shes bems po'i rang bzhin las //
translated: This is stated in the following:üîΩConsciousness arises in the opposite way

original: bzlog pa rab tu skye ba ste //
analyzed: bzlog pa rab tu skye ba ste //
translated: From the nature of matter.

original: bems min rang bzhin gang yin pa //
analyzed: bems min rang bzhin gang yin pa //
translated: That which has the nature of non-matter

original: de nyid bdag nyid shes pa yin //üîΩgcig la cha med rang bzhin la //
analyzed: de nyid bdag nyid shes pa yin // gcig la cha med rang bzhin la //
translated: Is reflexive awareness itself.üîΩSince it is untenable for a single thing

original: gsum gyi bdag nyid mi 'thad phyir //
analyzed: gsum gyi bdag nyid mi 'thad phyir //
translated: Without parts to have three natures,

original: 'di yi rang bzhin rig pa ni //
analyzed: 'di yi rang bzhin rig pa ni //
translated: Its nature is not

original: bya dang byed po'i dngos por min //
analyzed: bya dang byed po'i dngos por min //
translated: An entity of an agent and action.

original: zhe na / 'di la brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: zhe na / 'di la brjod par bya ste /
translated: To this we respond:

original: bya ba dang byed pa po'i khyad par gyi tha snyad las grub pa'i sgra'i don rtogs pas nyes pa brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: bya ba dang byed pa po'i khyad par gyi tha snyad las grub pa'i sgra'i don rtogs pas nyes pa brjod pa yin te /
translated: The fault is stated because the meaning of the term is understood from the convention of the distinction between action and agent.

original: rang rig pa'i sgras de'i don brjod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang rig pa'i sgras de'i don brjod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the term ‚Äúreflexive awareness‚Äù expresses that meaning.

original: gal te yang nyes pas 'jigs nas 'jig rten la grags pa'i sgra'i don yongs su spong na /
analyzed: gal te yang nyes pas 'jigs nas 'jig rten la grags pa'i sgra'i don yongs su spong na /
translated: If, fearing the fault, you abandon the meaning of the term that is known in the world,

original: de'i tshe khyed la 'jig rten pa nyid kyis gnod por 'gyur la /
analyzed: de'i tshe khyed la 'jig rten pa nyid kyis gnod por 'gyur la /
translated: then you will be harmed by the world itself.

original: 'dis kyang rang rig pa don dam pa 'grub pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dis kyang rang rig pa don dam pa 'grub pa ma yin te /
translated: This also does not establish reflexive awareness.

original: de bzhin du rgyu dang / rkyen las skyes pa'i gzugs brnyan rang bzhin med pa nyid du brjod la /
analyzed: de bzhin du rgyu dang / rkyen las skyes pa'i gzugs brnyan rang bzhin med pa nyid du brjod la /
translated: In the same way, a reflection that arises from causes and conditions is said to be essenceless.

original: de ltar rang rig pa'i shes pa ni shin tu yang med pa yin te /
analyzed: de ltar rang rig pa'i shes pa ni shin tu yang med pa yin te /
translated: In that case, reflexive awareness is utterly nonexistent.

original: de kho na nyid du gnyug ma'i rang bzhin du med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de kho na nyid du gnyug ma'i rang bzhin du med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because it does not exist as the intrinsic nature of reality.

original: rang bzhin med par yang nam mkha'i autpala'i bdag nyid rang rig par yang rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rang bzhin med par yang nam mkha'i autpala'i bdag nyid rang rig par yang rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: It is also not reasonable for the nature of something essenceless to be reflexive awareness, like the nature of the sky flower.

original: dbu mar smra ba po rnams kyi dbang du byas te bems po'i rang bzhin yod pa ma yin zhing /
analyzed: dbu mar smra ba po rnams kyi dbang du byas te bems po'i rang bzhin yod pa ma yin zhing /
translated: From the perspective of the proponents of the Middle Way, the nature of matter does not exist.

original: gang gis bems po'i las bzlog pa bems po ma yin pa'i rang rig par 'gyur ba don dam par gang zhig kyang yod pa ma yin no //üîΩde lta bas na dngos por smra ba gzhan nyid kyi dbang du byas te /
analyzed: gang gis bems po'i las bzlog pa bems po ma yin pa'i rang rig par 'gyur ba don dam par gang zhig kyang yod pa ma yin no // de lta bas na dngos por smra ba gzhan nyid kyi dbang du byas te /
translated: And ultimately, there is nothing that is not matter, that is, nothing that is reflexive awareness, which is the opposite of matter.

original: 'di smra bar rigs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di smra bar rigs pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is reasonable to speak of this from the perspective of others, the Proponents of Things.

original: de'i phyir na rang bzhin med pa nyid kyis nam yang rang rig pa grub pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir na rang bzhin med pa nyid kyis nam yang rang rig pa grub pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, because of the absence of intrinsic reality, self-awareness is never established.

original: 'di yang phyi nas dran pa nye bar gzhag pa ston pa'i skabs su rgyas par bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di yang phyi nas dran pa nye bar gzhag pa ston pa'i skabs su rgyas par bstan par bya'o //
translated: This will be taught extensively later in the section on the establishment of mindfulness.

original: da ni mar me rang nyid gsal bar khas blangs nas blo la rang rig pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i ched du mar me zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: da ni mar me rang nyid gsal bar khas blangs nas blo la rang rig pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i ched du mar me zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Now, in order to teach that, having accepted that a lamp is self-illuminating, the mind is not self-aware, [the author] declares the lamp, etc.

original: mar me rab tu gsal ba'i bdag nyid du gyur pa de lta na yang blo rang rig par bsgrub pa la 'dra ba'i dpe ma yin no zhes pa ni bsdus pa'i don to //üîΩmar me gsal @206a * //
analyzed: mar me rab tu gsal ba'i bdag nyid du gyur pa de lta na yang blo rang rig par bsgrub pa la 'dra ba'i dpe ma yin no zhes pa ni bsdus pa'i don to // mar me gsal @206a * //
translated: The condensed meaning is: although a lamp has the nature of being very bright, it is not a similar example for establishing the mind as self-aware.

original: bar byed do zhes pa ni gsal bar byed pa gzhan la mi ltos par rang nyid kyis gsal ba yin no zhes shes par byas nas te /
analyzed: bar byed do zhes pa ni gsal bar byed pa gzhan la mi ltos par rang nyid kyis gsal ba yin no zhes shes par byas nas te /
translated: The lamp illuminates means that it is understood that it is bright by itself, without relying on another illuminator.

original: shes pas go bar byas nas blos rjod par byed cing rab tu rtogs par byed de /
analyzed: shes pas go bar byas nas blos rjod par byed cing rab tu rtogs par byed de /
translated: Having understood that, the mind expresses and fully realizes it.

original: mar me shas pa'i yul yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mar me shas pa'i yul yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the object of the extinguished lamp.

original: blo ni shes pa yin la gsal ba nyid ces par gang brjod pa de yang gang gis shes nas te go bar byas nas /
analyzed: blo ni shes pa yin la gsal ba nyid ces par gang brjod pa de yang gang gis shes nas te go bar byas nas /
translated: ‚ÄúIntelligence‚Äù is consciousness. ‚ÄúClarity‚Äù is what is said. Having understood what, having made it understood, is it said?

original: brjod ces gzhan la dris pa yin te /
analyzed: brjod ces gzhan la dris pa yin te /
translated: It is asked of another.

original: 'dir yang blo rtogs par byed pa'i rgyu mtshan cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin no zhes pa'i sgra ni mi srid pa ston par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dir yang blo rtogs par byed pa'i rgyu mtshan cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin no zhes pa'i sgra ni mi srid pa ston par byed pa yin no //
translated: Here, too, the word ‚Äúnot‚Äù shows that there is not the slightest reason for the understanding of intelligence.

original: re zhig shes pa snga mas ni de rtogs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: re zhig shes pa snga mas ni de rtogs pa ma yin te /
translated: First, the former consciousness does not understand it,

original: de'i dus na ma skyes pa'i phyir de med pas so //
analyzed: de'i dus na ma skyes pa'i phyir de med pas so //
translated: because it does not exist at that time, since it has not yet arisen.

original: dus phyis 'byung bas kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: dus phyis 'byung bas kyang ma yin te /
translated: Nor does it arise later,

original: de'i tshe skad cig ma yin pa nyid kyis gzung bar bya ba 'das pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe skad cig ma yin pa nyid kyis gzung bar bya ba 'das pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because at that time the object to be grasped has already passed away, since it is momentary.

original: de dang dus mnyam par gyur pas kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: de dang dus mnyam par gyur pas kyang ma yin te /
translated: Nor does it occur simultaneously with it,

original: des de la phan mi 'dogs pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: des de la phan mi 'dogs pa'i phyir la /
translated: because it does not benefit it.

original: phan mi 'dogs pa yang yul gyi dngos po ma yin te /
analyzed: phan mi 'dogs pa yang yul gyi dngos po ma yin te /
translated: And that which does not benefit is not the object.

original: rgyu ma yin pa ni yul ma yin no zhes pa'i tshig gis so //
analyzed: rgyu ma yin pa ni yul ma yin no zhes pa'i tshig gis so //
translated: The words ‚Äúnot a non-cause‚Äù mean ‚Äúnot a non-object.‚Äù

original: rang gis kyang ma yin te de nyid la log par rtogs pas de ji ltar des rtogs zhes mi shes so //
analyzed: rang gis kyang ma yin te de nyid la log par rtogs pas de ji ltar des rtogs zhes mi shes so //
translated: Nor is it by itself, because it is a misconception about itself. How could it be understood by that? It is not known.

original: rnam pa thams cad du blos ma rtogs pa de'i rang rig pa shin tu yang mi rigs so zhes /üîΩgsal ba'am zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du blos ma rtogs pa de'i rang rig pa shin tu yang mi rigs so zhes / gsal ba'am zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: It is utterly unreasonable that it is reflexively aware of itself when it is not at all cognized by the mind.üîΩThe response to this is as follows:üîΩThe luminous

original: gsal ba'am ste /üîΩmar me bzhin du gsal ba'i bdag nyid dam /
analyzed: gsal ba'am ste / mar me bzhin du gsal ba'i bdag nyid dam /
translated: Or the non-luminous is not seen by anyone.

original: mi gsal ba ni bum pa bzhin du mi gsal ba ma yin la /
analyzed: mi gsal ba ni bum pa bzhin du mi gsal ba ma yin la /
translated: The luminous, that is, having the nature of clarity, like a lamp, or the non-luminous, that is, not clear, like a pot, is not seen by anyone.

original: phan tshun bsdu ba'i phyir 'am gyi sgra gnyis so //
analyzed: phan tshun bsdu ba'i phyir 'am gyi sgra gnyis so //
translated: The two ‚Äúor‚Äùs are for the purpose of including other possibilities.

original: blo ni gang che sus kyang mthong ba med pa ste /
analyzed: blo ni gang che sus kyang mthong ba med pa ste /
translated: The mind is not seen by anyone at all.

original: rtogs pa po 'ga' yang med la rtogs pa cung zad kyang med de rang dang gzhan gnyi gas kyang ma yin no //
analyzed: rtogs pa po 'ga' yang med la rtogs pa cung zad kyang med de rang dang gzhan gnyi gas kyang ma yin no //
translated: There is no cognizer whatsoever, and there is not the slightest thing to be cognized. It is not seen by itself, by another, or by both.

original: gang tshe zhes pa'i tshig gis de tshe zhes pa 'dren par byed de /
analyzed: gang tshe zhes pa'i tshig gis de tshe zhes pa 'dren par byed de /
translated: The word ‚Äúwhen‚Äù is used to introduce the phrase ‚Äúat that time.‚Äù

original: de'i tshe mo gsham ni mi skye ba'i chos can gyi bud med yin la /
analyzed: de'i tshe mo gsham ni mi skye ba'i chos can gyi bud med yin la /
translated: At that time, the barren woman is a woman who is not the referent of the term ‚Äúwoman who gives birth to a child.‚Äù

original: de'i bu mo'i rol pa ni sgeg pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: de'i bu mo'i rol pa ni sgeg pa nyid yin te /
translated: Her daughter‚Äôs play is her beauty.

original: de bzhin du brjod kyang ste bstan kyang ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin du brjod kyang ste bstan kyang ngo //
translated: In the same way, even though it is expressed, even though it is taught,

original: de don med pa ni ste don dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: de don med pa ni ste don dang bral ba'o //
translated: it is meaningless, it is devoid of meaning.

original: mo gsham gyi bu mo med pa nyid kyis ma rtogs pa'i phyir de'i rol pa shin tu yang mi rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: mo gsham gyi bu mo med pa nyid kyis ma rtogs pa'i phyir de'i rol pa shin tu yang mi rtogs pa yin no //
translated: Because the daughter of a barren woman does not exist, her play is not at all understood.

original: yang na ma skyes pa dang ma 'gags pa'i rang bzhin yin pas mo gsham gyi bu mo lta bu ni blo yin la /
analyzed: yang na ma skyes pa dang ma 'gags pa'i rang bzhin yin pas mo gsham gyi bu mo lta bu ni blo yin la /
translated: Or, the mind is like the daughter of a barren woman because it has the nature of being unborn and unceasing.

original: ma rtogs pa'i rang @206b bzhin yin pas de'i rol pa dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: ma rtogs pa'i rang @206b bzhin yin pas de'i rol pa dang 'dra ste /
translated: Because it has the nature of being non-apprehended, it is like her play.

original: rang rig pa des ma rtogs pa'i phyir de'i rtogs pa yang med do //
analyzed: rang rig pa des ma rtogs pa'i phyir de'i rtogs pa yang med do //
translated: Because it is not apprehended by that reflexive awareness, its apprehension also does not exist.

original: de ni rang rig pa yin la /
analyzed: de ni rang rig pa yin la /
translated: That is reflexive awareness.

original: de ltar na brjod kyang rigs pa dang bral ba'i tshig tsam gyis don med pa ni blang bar bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir dgos pa med pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na brjod kyang rigs pa dang bral ba'i tshig tsam gyis don med pa ni blang bar bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir dgos pa med pa yin no //
translated: In that case, because it is meaningless, because it is mere words devoid of reason, it is pointless because it is not to be accepted.

original: de lta mod kyi 'di ni rigs pas stong zhing tshig tsam ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta mod kyi 'di ni rigs pas stong zhing tshig tsam ma yin te /
translated: Although that is so, this is not empty of reasoning, but is mere words.

original: gang gi phyir 'di la rigs pa 'di yod do zhes brjod pa /üîΩgal te zhes pa la sogs te //
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'di la rigs pa 'di yod do zhes brjod pa / gal te zhes pa la sogs te //
translated: Because this has the following reasoning, it is said:

original: gal te rang rig yod min na //
analyzed: gal te rang rig yod min na //
translated: If there is no self-awareness,üîΩhow can consciousness be remembered?

original: zhes te / gal te rang rig pa'i rnam par shes pa med cing yod pa ma yin pa de'i tshe rnam shes ji ltar dran par 'gyur te /
analyzed: zhes te / gal te rang rig pa'i rnam par shes pa med cing yod pa ma yin pa de'i tshe rnam shes ji ltar dran par 'gyur te /
translated: If there is no self-aware consciousness, and it does not exist, then how can consciousness be remembered?

original: rnam par shes pa la rang rig med pa'i phyir dus phyis dran par mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa la rang rig med pa'i phyir dus phyis dran par mi 'gyur la /
translated: Because consciousness lacks self-awareness, it will not be remembered later.

original: nyams su ma myong ba ni dran par mi nus te /
analyzed: nyams su ma myong ba ni dran par mi nus te /
translated: That which is not experienced cannot be remembered,

original: ha cang thal bar 'gyur bas so //
analyzed: ha cang thal bar 'gyur bas so //
translated: because it would follow that anything could be remembered.

original: de lta bas na nyams su myong ba'i 'bras bu dran pa dus phyis dmigs pa'i phyir rang rig pa'i shes pa yod do zhes dpag par bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na nyams su myong ba'i 'bras bu dran pa dus phyis dmigs pa'i phyir rang rig pa'i shes pa yod do zhes dpag par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, because the effect of experience, memory, is observed later, it should be inferred that there is a self-aware consciousness.

original: 'di yang sgrub par byed pa yin pas 'dis bsgrub par bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di yang sgrub par byed pa yin pas 'dis bsgrub par bya ba ma yin te /
translated: This is also a proof, so it does not prove what is to be proven by this.

original: gang gi phyir rang rig pa'i 'bras bu nyid du dran pa nges par 'gyur na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir rang rig pa'i 'bras bu nyid du dran pa nges par 'gyur na /
translated: Because if memory were ascertained to be the effect of reflexive awareness,

original: me dang du ba bzhin du dran pas rang rig pa sgrub par byed par 'gyur te /
analyzed: me dang du ba bzhin du dran pas rang rig pa sgrub par byed par 'gyur te /
translated: memory would establish reflexive awareness, just as smoke establishes fire.

original: tshad mas rang rig pa ma grub na dran pa de'i 'bras bur 'dzin pa ma yin te /
analyzed: tshad mas rang rig pa ma grub na dran pa de'i 'bras bur 'dzin pa ma yin te /
translated: If reflexive awareness is not established by a valid cognition, memory is not apprehended as its effect.

original: thams cad du rgyu dang 'bras bu rtogs pa ni gnyi ga rtogs pa med pa ma yin no //
analyzed: thams cad du rgyu dang 'bras bu rtogs pa ni gnyi ga rtogs pa med pa ma yin no //
translated: In all cases, the realization of cause and effect is not the realization of both.

original: mig la sogs pa la rnam par shes pa bzhin du ma mthong yang dran pa de'i 'bras bur ni grub pa ma yin te /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa la rnam par shes pa bzhin du ma mthong yang dran pa de'i 'bras bur ni grub pa ma yin te /
translated: Even though it is not seen that memory is like consciousness in relation to the eye and so on, it is not established as the effect of that.

original: mig med par sngon po la sogs pa'i shes pa med pas ldog pa'i sgo nas de'i 'bras bur rjes su dpog go //
analyzed: mig med par sngon po la sogs pa'i shes pa med pas ldog pa'i sgo nas de'i 'bras bur rjes su dpog go //
translated: Because without the eye, there is no consciousness of blue and so on, it is inferred to be its effect through elimination.

original: dran pa ni rang rig pa'i shes pa med kyang 'byung ngo zhes 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dran pa ni rang rig pa'i shes pa med kyang 'byung ngo zhes 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: It will be explained that memory arises even without reflexive awareness.

original: de'i phyir rang rig pa'i 'bras bu nyid du nges pa med par dran pa ni de med pa yang 'byung bas rang rig pa grub pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir rang rig pa'i 'bras bu nyid du nges pa med par dran pa ni de med pa yang 'byung bas rang rig pa grub pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, since memory occurs even when there is no certainty that it is the result of reflexive awareness, reflexive awareness is not established.

original: de'i phyir dran pa yang rnam par shes pa yin pa'i phyir ji ltar grub par 'gyur zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir dran pa yang rnam par shes pa yin pa'i phyir ji ltar grub par 'gyur zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, since memory is consciousness, how could it be established?

original: rang la rtags ma grub par ni gzhan gyi shes par byed pa ma yin la /
analyzed: rang la rtags ma grub par ni gzhan gyi shes par byed pa ma yin la /
translated: A reason that is not established for oneself does not prove anything for others.

original: dran pa ni rang rig pa la mngon sum nyid kyis 'dzin pa ma yin te /
analyzed: dran pa ni rang rig pa la mngon sum nyid kyis 'dzin pa ma yin te /
translated: Memory is not apprehended by direct perception in reflexive awareness,

original: de dang de bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩshes pa ni shes pa gzhan gyi yul ma yin te phyi rol gyi don bzhin du 'brel pa ma @207a * //
analyzed: de dang de bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro // shes pa ni shes pa gzhan gyi yul ma yin te phyi rol gyi don bzhin du 'brel pa ma @207a * //
translated: because it is not like that.

original: grub pa la sogs pa'i nyes par 'gyur bas so //
analyzed: grub pa la sogs pa'i nyes par 'gyur bas so //
translated: Consciousness is not the object of another consciousness, because, like an external object, it would be subject to the error of being unestablished as a connection.

original: gzhan nyid du khyad par med pas rgyu gzhan gyi dngos po de yang dran pas 'dzin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan nyid du khyad par med pas rgyu gzhan gyi dngos po de yang dran pas 'dzin par 'gyur ro //
translated: Since there is no difference in being different, that which is another cause would also be apprehended by memory.

original: 'on te des sngar nyams su ma myong bas na dran par mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te des sngar nyams su ma myong bas na dran par mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: But if it is argued that it is not remembered because it was not previously experienced,üîΩthen it follows that it is not remembered because it does not exist.

original: rgyud gcig tu gyur pa yang sngar nyams su ma myong ba'i thal bar 'gyur pa mtshungs so //
analyzed: rgyud gcig tu gyur pa yang sngar nyams su ma myong ba'i thal bar 'gyur pa mtshungs so //
translated: It would also follow, absurdly, that the single continuum would not have been experienced before.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu na yang de la nges byed rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu na yang de la nges byed rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: It is also not logical to posit a cause and effect in this case,

original: don dam par rgyud dang 'bras bu nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don dam par rgyud dang 'bras bu nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because ultimately there is no such thing as a continuum or cause and effect.

original: shes pa thams cad la de yod kyang rang nyid rtogs pa la mthar thug pa yin pa'i phyir dang / de 'dzin par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes pa thams cad la de yod kyang rang nyid rtogs pa la mthar thug pa yin pa'i phyir dang / de 'dzin par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Even though it exists in all consciousnesses, it is the ultimate realization of the self, and it is not possible to apprehend it.

original: ji ltar tha snyad khas blangs pa na brtags pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: ji ltar tha snyad khas blangs pa na brtags pa nyid yin te /
translated: When one accepts the conventional, it is just an imputation.

original: brtags pa nyid yin pa na yang tha snyad thams cad rtogs pas sprul pa yin pa'i phyir kun rdzob bsgrub bya yin pas don dam pa ma bsgrubs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: brtags pa nyid yin pa na yang tha snyad thams cad rtogs pas sprul pa yin pa'i phyir kun rdzob bsgrub bya yin pas don dam pa ma bsgrubs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Even though it is just an imputation, since all conventions are understood, it is an emanation, and therefore it is the object to be established by the conventional, and not the ultimate.

original: de ltar dran pas rang rig pa grub pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar dran pas rang rig pa grub pa ma yin no //
translated: Thus memory does not establish autocognition.

original: ji ltar khyed la yang rang rig pa med par dran pa ji ltar 'grub ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar khyed la yang rang rig pa med par dran pa ji ltar 'grub ce na /
translated: How is it that you do not have autocognition, but memory is established?

original: gzhan myong ba na 'brel pa las zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gzhan myong ba na 'brel pa las zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: When another is experienced, it is said, ‚Äúfrom the connection.‚Äù

original: 'dir shes pa las gzhan gzung bar bya ba'i dngos po yul du gyur ba nyams su myong ba ni shes pa la dran pa skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dir shes pa las gzhan gzung bar bya ba'i dngos po yul du gyur ba nyams su myong ba ni shes pa la dran pa skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Here, the experience of an object, a thing to be grasped that is other than consciousness, gives rise to memory of the consciousness.

original: gzhan myong bas gzhan dran pa ni rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan myong bas gzhan dran pa ni rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: It is illogical that the memory of one thing arises from the experience of another.

original: shin tu thal bar 'gyur pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: shin tu thal bar 'gyur pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: This is because it would follow, absurdly, that anything could be the memory of anything.

original: 'brel pa las zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: 'brel pa las zhes gsungs te /
translated: ‚ÄúFrom the connection‚Äù is said.

original: yul dran pa na 'brel pa las shes pa dran par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yul dran pa na 'brel pa las shes pa dran par 'gyur ro //
translated: When the object is remembered, the consciousness is remembered from the connection.

original: rnam par shes pa yang de'i 'dzin pa nyid yin pas de dang 'brel pa yin te /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa yang de'i 'dzin pa nyid yin pas de dang 'brel pa yin te /
translated: Consciousness is also the apprehender of that object, and so it is connected to it.

original: de'i phyir rnam par shes pa dran pa yin te gzhan du ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam par shes pa dran pa yin te gzhan du ma yin no //
translated: Therefore it is the consciousness that is remembered, not something else.

original: 'brel pa bden yang 'di ma myong na gzhan dran pa ni bslad pa'i dran par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'brel pa bden yang 'di ma myong na gzhan dran pa ni bslad pa'i dran par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: Even if the connection is real, if this is not experienced, the memory of something else would be a distorted memory.

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: No, it is not.

original: sngar nyams su myong ba'i yul phyis rjes su dran pa na myong ba khyad par can de nyid dran pa yin te /
analyzed: sngar nyams su myong ba'i yul phyis rjes su dran pa na myong ba khyad par can de nyid dran pa yin te /
translated: When a previously experienced object is later remembered, it is that very special experience that is remembered,

original: des khyad par du byas pa de 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des khyad par du byas pa de 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is that which is apprehended as qualified.

original: shes pa nyid yul nyams su myong ba yin la gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir yul nyams su myong ba dran pa las de dang 'brel pas shes pa dran par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: shes pa nyid yul nyams su myong ba yin la gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir yul nyams su myong ba dran pa las de dang 'brel pas shes pa dran par brjod par bya'o //
translated: Since consciousness itself is the experience of the object and not something else, the memory of the experience of the object is described as the memory of the consciousness associated with it.

original: yul spangs pa'i shes pa nyid 'ba' zhig ni dran pa ma yin pa'i phyir nyes pa med do //
analyzed: yul spangs pa'i shes pa nyid 'ba' zhig ni dran pa ma yin pa'i phyir nyes pa med do //
translated: There is no fault, because it is not the case that consciousness alone, devoid of an object, is remembered.

original: ci ste myong ba'i shes pas gzhag pa'i dran pas bag chags kyi sa bon med par phyis dran @207b pa skyed pa ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: ci ste myong ba'i shes pas gzhag pa'i dran pas bag chags kyi sa bon med par phyis dran @207b pa skyed pa ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: But how can memory arise later from the seed of the latent impression, which is established by the consciousness of the experience, without that?

original: byi ba'i dug ces gsungs te /
analyzed: byi ba'i dug ces gsungs te /
translated: The example of rat poison is stated.

original: byi ba'i dug ni ji ltar 'brel par phyis skye bar 'gyur pa de bzhin du dran pa yang yin no zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: byi ba'i dug ni ji ltar 'brel par phyis skye bar 'gyur pa de bzhin du dran pa yang yin no zhes pa'i don to //
translated: Just as rat poison arises later in connection with the rats, so too is memory.

original: 'di ltar byi ba'i dug skad cig ma gcig la lus la 'phos nas yang dus gzhan du 'brug gi sgra'i rkyen dang phrad pa las rang rig pas gzhag pa'i dran pa'i bag chags kyi sa bon med par yang rkyen dang phrad pa nyid kyi phyir skad cig ma
analyzed: 'di ltar byi ba'i dug skad cig ma gcig la lus la 'phos nas yang dus gzhan du 'brug gi sgra'i rkyen dang phrad pa las rang rig pas gzhag pa'i dran pa'i bag chags kyi sa bon med par yang rkyen dang phrad pa nyid kyi phyir skad cig ma
translated: In this way, the poison of a mouse is transferred to the body in a single moment, and later, due to the condition of the sound of thunder, even without the seed of the latent tendency of memory that is posited by reflexive awareness, it is obtained in another moment due to the condition of the sound of thunder alone.

original: gzhan du rnam par 'gyur ba thob ste /
analyzed: gzhan du rnam par 'gyur ba thob ste /
translated: It is obtained in another moment due to the condition of the sound of thunder alone.

original: de bzhin du skabs su bab pa la yang skyon med do zhes dgongs so //
analyzed: de bzhin du skabs su bab pa la yang skyon med do zhes dgongs so //
translated: In the same way, there is no fault in the present context, he thinks.

original: slar yang rnam par shes pa tsam du smra bas rang rig pa grub par bya ba'i ched du rnam pa gzhan bstan pa'i phyir rkyen gzhan dag dang zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: slar yang rnam par shes pa tsam du smra bas rang rig pa grub par bya ba'i ched du rnam pa gzhan bstan pa'i phyir rkyen gzhan dag dang zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Again, in order to prove reflexive awareness, the Proponents of Consciousness set forth another position:

original: rkyen gzhan ni dus gzhan yin te /
analyzed: rkyen gzhan ni dus gzhan yin te /
translated: Other conditions are other times.

original: lta ba'i rig pa la sogs pa dang gzhan gyi sems shes pa la sogs pa'i mngon par shes pa dag dang ldan pas de'i tshogs pa dang 'brel pa'i sems mthong ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: lta ba'i rig pa la sogs pa dang gzhan gyi sems shes pa la sogs pa'i mngon par shes pa dag dang ldan pas de'i tshogs pa dang 'brel pa'i sems mthong ba'i phyir te /
translated: Because the mind that is connected with the assembly of those who possess superknowledges, such as the knowledge of seeing the minds of others, and so on, is seen.

original: snang ba'i phyir rnam par shes pa rang nyid gsal te rang bzhin gsal zhing rig pa yod do zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: snang ba'i phyir rnam par shes pa rang nyid gsal te rang bzhin gsal zhing rig pa yod do zhes pa'i don to //
translated: Because it appears, consciousness is itself clear; it has a clear, aware nature.

original: gal te yang de thams cad du lkog tu gyur pa'i rang bzhin yin na ji ltar tshogs pa'i khyad par las brgya la yang dmigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gal te yang de thams cad du lkog tu gyur pa'i rang bzhin yin na ji ltar tshogs pa'i khyad par las brgya la yang dmigs pa ma yin te /
translated: But if it is a nature that is always hidden, then how is it ever apprehended?

original: de'i phyir dper na tshogs pa'i khyad par las gzhan gyi sems dmigs pa de bzhin du de ma thag pa'i rkyen dang dmigs pa'i rkyen la sogs pa las rang gi sems kyang dmigs pa yin no zhes bsams pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir dper na tshogs pa'i khyad par las gzhan gyi sems dmigs pa de bzhin du de ma thag pa'i rkyen dang dmigs pa'i rkyen la sogs pa las rang gi sems kyang dmigs pa yin no zhes bsams pa'o //
translated: Therefore, just as the mind of another is apprehended from a special collection, in the same way, one's own mind is also apprehended from the immediately preceding condition, the objective condition, and so on.

original: 'dis kyang shes pa'i rig pa sgrub pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir grub pa'i mig sman zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: 'dis kyang shes pa'i rig pa sgrub pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir grub pa'i mig sman zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: This also does not prove the awareness of consciousness, so to demonstrate this, NƒÅgƒÅrjuna says, ‚ÄúThe application of the established eye medicine,‚Äù and so on.

original: grub pa yang yin la mig sman yang yin pas grub pa'i mig sman no //
analyzed: grub pa yang yin la mig sman yang yin pas grub pa'i mig sman no //
translated: It is established and it is eye medicine, so it is the established eye medicine.

original: de'i sbyor ba ni rnam par sbyor ba'am rab tu sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: de'i sbyor ba ni rnam par sbyor ba'am rab tu sbyor ba'o //
translated: Its application is its application or its employment.

original: de las mthong ba ni bum pa'am gter la sogs pa yin la /
analyzed: de las mthong ba ni bum pa'am gter la sogs pa yin la /
translated: What is seen is a pot, treasure, and so on.

original: de 'di ltar mig sman nyid 'gyur min te /
analyzed: de 'di ltar mig sman nyid 'gyur min te /
translated: It is not that the eye ointment itself becomes that.

original: bum pa la sogs pa mig sman du 'gyur ba ma yin la /
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa mig sman du 'gyur ba ma yin la /
translated: A pot and so on do not become eye ointment.

original: gang las rtogs pa de der 'gyur ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gang las rtogs pa de der 'gyur ba ni ma yin te /
translated: And that from which one gains knowledge does not become that.

original: de bzhin du lta ba po'i rigs pa la sogs pa dang lhan cig pa'i shes pas gzhan gyi sems bum pa la sogs ltar mthong na re zhig de rigs par grub par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de bzhin du lta ba po'i rigs pa la sogs pa dang lhan cig pa'i shes pas gzhan gyi sems bum pa la sogs ltar mthong na re zhig de rigs par grub par mi 'gyur te /
translated: In the same way, if the mind that is simultaneous with the reasoning consciousness of the viewer sees the other mind like a pot and so on, then for the time being it is not established by reasoning.

original: de lta bas na 'di ni bsgrub bya la ma kho ba'i sgrub @208a * //üîΩpar byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na 'di ni bsgrub bya la ma kho ba'i sgrub @208a * // par byed pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore this is a proof that does not touch the probandum.

original: gal te shes pa rig pa'i ngo bor ma gyur na don yang rtogs par mi 'gyur ba ma yin na ma shes pa ni mi gsal ba gsal bar byed pa'i phyir te don ni gsal ba ma yin la /
analyzed: gal te shes pa rig pa'i ngo bor ma gyur na don yang rtogs par mi 'gyur ba ma yin na ma shes pa ni mi gsal ba gsal bar byed pa'i phyir te don ni gsal ba ma yin la /
translated: If consciousness did not become the essence of awareness, then the object would not be cognized. This is because the unknown, which is unclear, is made clear. The object is not clear.

original: de ma rtogs pa la don ci ltar rtogs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ma rtogs pa la don ci ltar rtogs par 'gyur te /
translated: And how could the object be cognized if it is not understood?

original: 'di ltar rang rig pa bkag pa'i phyir dang / gzhan gyis gzhan 'dzin pa yang mi rigs pa'i phyir phyi ma phyi mas 'dzin par khas blangs pa na yang ma rtogs pa rtogs par bya ba'i ched du shes pa gzhan don du gnyer bas thug pa med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i yang phyir ji ltar yang don
analyzed: 'di ltar rang rig pa bkag pa'i phyir dang / gzhan gyis gzhan 'dzin pa yang mi rigs pa'i phyir phyi ma phyi mas 'dzin par khas blangs pa na yang ma rtogs pa rtogs par bya ba'i ched du shes pa gzhan don du gnyer bas thug pa med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i yang phyir ji ltar yang don
translated: Because self-awareness is refuted in this way, and because it is illogical for one thing to apprehend another, even if you accept that the latter consciousnesses apprehend the former ones, since consciousnesses would be pursued for the sake of other consciousnesses in order to make the unrealized realized, the absurd consequence of an infinite regress would ensue.

original: rtogs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rtogs pa ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, in no way is an object realized.

original: des na gang gzhan myong ba la sogs pa zhes brjod pa de rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: des na gang gzhan myong ba la sogs pa zhes brjod pa de rigs pa ma yin te /
