translated: Thus, it is illogical to say that something else experiences and so on.

original: don nyams su myong ba med pa'i phyir 'jig rten na mthong ba'i tha snyad 'di thams cad med par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: don nyams su myong ba med pa'i phyir 'jig rten na mthong ba'i tha snyad 'di thams cad med par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: Since there is no experience of an object, all of these conventions seen in the world would not exist.

original: ji ltar mthong thos zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /üîΩgang mthong ba la sogs pa'i tha snyad med par 'gyur ro zhes pa de don dam pa'am /
analyzed: ji ltar mthong thos zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te / gang mthong ba la sogs pa'i tha snyad med par 'gyur ro zhes pa de don dam pa'am /
translated: In response to that, NƒÅgƒÅrjuna explains, ‚ÄúHow could seeing, hearing, and so on not exist?‚Äù

original: kun rdzob tu med par 'gyur /
analyzed: kun rdzob tu med par 'gyur /
translated: If you say that the conventions of seeing and so on would not exist, do you mean that they would not exist ultimately or that they would not exist conventionally?

original: de la gal te don dam par med par 'gyur ro zhes brjod na de'i tshe 'di ni bdag 'dod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de la gal te don dam par med par 'gyur ro zhes brjod na de'i tshe 'di ni bdag 'dod pa ma yin te /
translated: If you say that it does not exist ultimately, then I do not accept that.

original: kun rdzob tu don dam pa la dpyad pa 'jug pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: kun rdzob tu don dam pa la dpyad pa 'jug pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: For, in the ultimate, there is no engagement in analysis of the conventional.

original: 'on te 'jig rten gyi grags pas yin na de'i tshe ;
analyzed: 'on te 'jig rten gyi grags pas yin na de'i tshe ;
translated: But if you say that it is known in the world, then

original: ji ltar mthong thos shes pa kun //
analyzed: ji ltar mthong thos shes pa kun //
translated: all that is seen, heard, and known

original: 'dir ni dgag pa bya min te //
analyzed: 'dir ni dgag pa bya min te //
translated: is not to be refuted here.

original: zhes so // ji ltar mthong ba zhes mig la sogs pa'i shes pas mngon sum du mthong ba yin la /
analyzed: zhes so // ji ltar mthong ba zhes mig la sogs pa'i shes pas mngon sum du mthong ba yin la /
translated: Here, ‚Äúseen‚Äù is directly perceived by the consciousnesses such as the eyes.

original: thos pa zhes pa ni gang zag gzhan las dang lung las so //
analyzed: thos pa zhes pa ni gang zag gzhan las dang lung las so //
translated: ‚ÄúHeard‚Äù is from other persons or from scriptures.

original: shes pa zhes pa ni tshul gsum pa'i rtags las skyes pa'i rjes su dpag par nges pa'o //
analyzed: shes pa zhes pa ni tshul gsum pa'i rtags las skyes pa'i rjes su dpag par nges pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúKnown‚Äù is ascertained from an inference produced from a sign having the three modes.

original: de nyid 'dir tha snyad thams cad la brten te dgag par bya min zhes pa mi bzlog pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid 'dir tha snyad thams cad la brten te dgag par bya min zhes pa mi bzlog pa'o //
translated: All of that is not to be refuted here, that is, is not to be rejected, in dependence on all conventions.

original: gang ji ltar 'jig rten na rab tu grags pa de de bzhin nyid du ma dpyad pa'i ngo bo khas blangs nas 'jig rten na grags pa yin te don dam pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gang ji ltar 'jig rten na rab tu grags pa de de bzhin nyid du ma dpyad pa'i ngo bo khas blangs nas 'jig rten na grags pa yin te don dam pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Whatever is well known in the world, that is accepted just as it is, without analysis, as the nature of things. It is known in the world, but not ultimately.

original: des na shes pa'i rig pa med pas don rtogs pa la sogs pa med ces pa'i nyes pa don dam pa'i phyogs smra ba la 'dir glags mi rnyed do //
analyzed: des na shes pa'i rig pa med pas don rtogs pa la sogs pa med ces pa'i nyes pa don dam pa'i phyogs smra ba la 'dir glags mi rnyed do //
translated: Therefore, the fault that the opponent states, namely, that since the awareness of cognition does not exist, the understanding of objects and so on do not exist, does not apply to us.

original: gal te de de bzhin du khas len pa na de kho na ji lta bu zhig 'gags she na /
analyzed: gal te de de bzhin du khas len pa na de kho na ji lta bu zhig 'gags she na /
translated: If one accepts that, then what sort of reality is refuted?

original: 'dir ni sdug bsngal zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: 'dir ni sdug bsngal zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Here, he says, ‚ÄúSuffering and so on,‚Äù and so forth.

original: bden pa ni don @208b dam pa yin te rtogs pas sgro btags pa ma yin pa yang zhes pa'i don ni slar gyi don to //
analyzed: bden pa ni don @208b dam pa yin te rtogs pas sgro btags pa ma yin pa yang zhes pa'i don ni slar gyi don to //
translated: Reality is the ultimate, and ‚Äúnot fabricated by thought‚Äù means ‚Äúnot again.‚Äù

original: de yang 'dir spyod pa'am grub mtha' bzlog par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: de yang 'dir spyod pa'am grub mtha' bzlog par bya ba yin te /
translated: That is to be rejected here, either as conduct or as a tenet.

original: dgag par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: dgag par bya ba yin no //
translated: It is to be refuted.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: sdug bsngal gyi zhes te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi zhes te /
translated: ‚ÄúBecause of suffering.‚Äù

original: 'di ni rgyu'i tshig yin la /
analyzed: 'di ni rgyu'i tshig yin la /
translated: This is a reason.

original: gang gi phyir sdug bsngal gyi rgyu ste byed pa yin pa de'i phyir zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: gang gi phyir sdug bsngal gyi rgyu ste byed pa yin pa de'i phyir zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúbecause‚Äù is ‚Äúbecause it is the cause of suffering.‚Äù

original: nye bar len pa'i phung po rnams yod pa dang med pa la sogs pa brtags pas gzhag pa 'jug pa'i rgyu nyid ni 'khor ba yin te /
analyzed: nye bar len pa'i phung po rnams yod pa dang med pa la sogs pa brtags pas gzhag pa 'jug pa'i rgyu nyid ni 'khor ba yin te /
translated: Samsara is the cause of engaging in positing the appropriated aggregates through the conception of existence, nonexistence, and so on.üîΩThe origin of suffering is the world,

original: sdug bsngal kun 'byung 'jig rten dang // lta gnas sred pa'ang de dag nyid //
analyzed: sdug bsngal kun 'byung 'jig rten dang // lta gnas sred pa'ang de dag nyid //
translated: and the abode of views is craving.

original: ces pa'i tshig las de ltar bden par rtogs pa ni sdug bsngal gyi rgyu yin no //
analyzed: ces pa'i tshig las de ltar bden par rtogs pa ni sdug bsngal gyi rgyu yin no //
translated: Thus the realization of things as truly existent is the cause of suffering.

original: de lta bas na 'dir ni bden pa ma yin pa'i 'dogs pa rtogs pa'i mngon par zhen pa dgag pa tsam bzhed pa yin la /
analyzed: de lta bas na 'dir ni bden pa ma yin pa'i 'dogs pa rtogs pa'i mngon par zhen pa dgag pa tsam bzhed pa yin la /
translated: Therefore here the mere elimination of the conception that apprehends things as not being true is asserted,

original: dngos po cung zad gcig ni 'dir dgag pa ma yin no /
analyzed: dngos po cung zad gcig ni 'dir dgag pa ma yin no /
translated: but not the elimination of any existent thing.

original: de'i phyir de ltar na rang rig pa'i shes pa cung zad kyang rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar na rang rig pa'i shes pa cung zad kyang rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: Thus it is not at all tenable that there is reflexive awareness.

original: rtogs bya rtogs byed rnam pa'i sems //
analyzed: rtogs bya rtogs byed rnam pa'i sems //
translated: The mind that has the aspect of the object of awareness

original: de bzhin gshegs pas gzigs pa med //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas gzigs pa med //
translated: is not seen by the TathƒÅgata.

original: gang du rtogs dang rtogs byed pa //
analyzed: gang du rtogs dang rtogs byed pa //
translated: Where there is realization and the realizer,

original: de la byang chub sems yod min //
analyzed: de la byang chub sems yod min //
translated: there is no thought of enlightenment.

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: gang der cung zad bcom ldan 'das kyis sems tsam nyid du yod par gsungs pa de phung po dang skye mched la sogs pa bzhin du drang ba'i don nyid yin par bshad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang der cung zad bcom ldan 'das kyis sems tsam nyid du yod par gsungs pa de phung po dang skye mched la sogs pa bzhin du drang ba'i don nyid yin par bshad par 'gyur ro //
translated: And whatever the Lord has said about the existence of mind-only, that is to be explained as interpretable in meaning, like the aggregates, media, etc.

original: da ni zhar la byung ba yongs su rdzogs par byas nas /
analyzed: da ni zhar la byung ba yongs su rdzogs par byas nas /
translated: Now, having completed the digression,

original: skabs su bab pa la sbyar ba'i phyir /
analyzed: skabs su bab pa la sbyar ba'i phyir /
translated: in order to apply it to the present context,

original: sems las sgyu ma zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: sems las sgyu ma zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says, ‚ÄúThe illusion is not different from the mind,‚Äù etc.

original: 'di ltar sems las sgyu ma gzhan yin par 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: 'di ltar sems las sgyu ma gzhan yin par 'gyur ba'am /
translated: Thus, the illusion would be different from the mind,

original: gzhan ma yin par 'gyur ba'am /üîΩgnyi ga'i rang bzhin yin pa'am /
analyzed: gzhan ma yin par 'gyur ba'am / gnyi ga'i rang bzhin yin pa'am /
translated: or it would not be different,üîΩor it would be both,

original: gnyi ga'i rang bzhin ma yin pa zhes brtag pa bzhi'o //
analyzed: gnyi ga'i rang bzhin ma yin pa zhes brtag pa bzhi'o //
translated: or it would be neither.

original: de la re zhig phyogs dang po ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de la re zhig phyogs dang po ni ma yin te /
translated: Of these, the first position is not tenable.

original: sems las gzhan khas len na yang 'gro ba sems tsam du 'dod pa'i grub mtha' dang 'gal bar 'gyur ro //üîΩrnam par rtog pa gnyis pa la yang gang gi tshe /üîΩkhyod la sgyu ma nyid med na //
analyzed: sems las gzhan khas len na yang 'gro ba sems tsam du 'dod pa'i grub mtha' dang 'gal bar 'gyur ro // rnam par rtog pa gnyis pa la yang gang gi tshe / khyod la sgyu ma nyid med na //
translated: If you accept something other than mind, you contradict the philosophical tenet that the world is mind only.

original: zhes pa la sogs pa bstan pa nyid kyis nyes pa yod do //
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa bstan pa nyid kyis nyes pa yod do //
translated: In the second case, the error is shown by the words ‚ÄúIf for you, illusion itself does not exist,‚Äù and so on.

original: rnam pa gsum pa yang mi 'thad do //
analyzed: rnam pa gsum pa yang mi 'thad do //
translated: The third case is also untenable.

original: gcig la phan tshun 'gal ba mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gcig la phan tshun 'gal ba mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is impossible for something to be both mutually exclusive properties in a single basis.

original: 'on te brtag pa bzhi pa yin na de yang 'brel pa ma yin la /üîΩde nye @209a * //
analyzed: 'on te brtag pa bzhi pa yin na de yang 'brel pa ma yin la / de nye @209a * //
translated: If the fourth case is what you are considering, that is also incoherent.

original: bar bzung nas brjod par bya ste /üîΩsems las sgyu ma gzhan min zhing //
analyzed: bar bzung nas brjod par bya ste / sems las sgyu ma gzhan min zhing //
translated: Let me explain this by taking up this point.

original: zhes pas gzhan nyid 'gegs so //
analyzed: zhes pas gzhan nyid 'gegs so //
translated: The words ‚ÄúThe illusion is not different from the mind‚Äù refute difference.

original: 'o na gzhan ma yin pa yang yin no zhe na /üîΩgzhan min par yang mi rtag na //
analyzed: 'o na gzhan ma yin pa yang yin no zhe na / gzhan min par yang mi rtag na //
translated: ‚ÄúBut it is not different.‚Äù

original: zhes te / de nyid yin pa'ang 'gegs pa yin la /
analyzed: zhes te / de nyid yin pa'ang 'gegs pa yin la /
translated: The words ‚ÄúNor is it the same‚Äù refute that it is the same.

original: de ltar na gnyi ga bkag pa'i phyogs yin no zhes rtog cing rnam pa gzhan byed na /
analyzed: de ltar na gnyi ga bkag pa'i phyogs yin no zhes rtog cing rnam pa gzhan byed na /
translated: Thus, the position that refutes both is considered and another alternative is made.

original: de yang rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de yang rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: That also is not logical.

original: phan tshun spangs pa dang ldan pa ni gcig bkag pa gcig bsgrub pa med na mi 'byung ba yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: phan tshun spangs pa dang ldan pa ni gcig bkag pa gcig bsgrub pa med na mi 'byung ba yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because that which possesses mutual exclusion is not produced without the affirmation of one through the negation of another.

original: de dag gcig la mi srid pa'i phyir brtag pa bzhi pa yang mi 'thad do //üîΩyang dngos na zhes te gal te sgyu ma de dngos po yin na /
analyzed: de dag gcig la mi srid pa'i phyir brtag pa bzhi pa yang mi 'thad do // yang dngos na zhes te gal te sgyu ma de dngos po yin na /
translated: Because that is impossible for one thing, the fourth alternative is also untenable.

original: ji ltar de gzhan min te sems las gzhan du mi 'gyur /
analyzed: ji ltar de gzhan min te sems las gzhan du mi 'gyur /
translated: If it is real, then how could it not be different from the mind?

original: 'on te gal te gzhan min zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te gal te gzhan min zhe na /

original: sems nyid sgyu ma yin te /
analyzed: sems nyid sgyu ma yin te /

original: de'i tshe dngos por med de /
analyzed: de'i tshe dngos por med de /

analyzed: don dam par yod pa ma yin pa de la ste de'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: sems 'ba' zhig yin pa zhes pa 'di nyid 'ongs pa yin te / gang tshe khyod la sgyu ma nyid //
translated: This very statement, ‚ÄúIt is only the mind,‚Äù is appropriate.üîΩWhen the illusion itself does not exist for you,

analyzed: med na de tshe ci zhig dmigs //
translated: then what is observed?

original: zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa yin no //

analyzed: da ni skabs su bab pa'i bsgrub bya bya bsgrubs nas mjug bsdu ba'i phyir /

original: ji ltar sgyu ma yod min yang //
analyzed: ji ltar sgyu ma yod min yang //
translated: Just as an illusion does not exist,

original: zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /

original: dmigs par bya ba'i sgyu ma glang po che la sogs pa ltar dngos po med pa'am med pa'i rang bzhin yin pa ste /üîΩde lta bu yang ji ltar blta bya ste mthong ba'i yul sgyu ma yin pa ltar de bzhin lta byed yin kyang yin te /
analyzed: dmigs par bya ba'i sgyu ma glang po che la sogs pa ltar dngos po med pa'am med pa'i rang bzhin yin pa ste / de lta bu yang ji ltar blta bya ste mthong ba'i yul sgyu ma yin pa ltar de bzhin lta byed yin kyang yin te /

analyzed: med pa'i sgyu ma de nyid blta bar bya ba dang / lta ba de bzhin du yid yin te /

analyzed: don dam par med pa'i rang bzhin yin na yang mthong ba'i nus par 'gyur ro //

original: des na / gang tshe 'khrul pa'ang yod min na //
analyzed: des na / gang tshe 'khrul pa'ang yod min na //
translated: Therefore, when there is no error,

analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa pha rol gyis gang brjod pa des bsgrub par bya ba mjug bsdus nas bstan to //
translated: and so on, the opponent‚Äôs position is summarized and taught.

original: gzhan yang rnam pa gzhan gyi don dam par yod pa'i rnam par shes pa bsgrub pa'i ched du gzhan gyis 'bad pa'i bsam pas /
analyzed: gzhan yang rnam pa gzhan gyi don dam par yod pa'i rnam par shes pa bsgrub pa'i ched du gzhan gyis 'bad pa'i bsam pas /

original: gal te 'khor ba dngos rten can //
analyzed: gal te 'khor ba dngos rten can //
translated: If cyclic existence has a basis,

original: zhes smras te /
analyzed: zhes smras te /
translated: then it is said:

original: de la 'dod chags la sogs pa'i dri mas bsgribs @209b pa'i sems la kun nas nyon mongs pa zhes brjod la /
analyzed: de la 'dod chags la sogs pa'i dri mas bsgribs @209b pa'i sems la kun nas nyon mongs pa zhes brjod la /
translated: In this regard, a mind that is obscured by the stains of desire and so on is called defiled.

original: de yang yang dag pa ma yin pa'i sgro btags pa'i stobs kyis bskyed pa'i phyir glo bur ba'i sems la brten nas 'jug go //
analyzed: de yang yang dag pa ma yin pa'i sgro btags pa'i stobs kyis bskyed pa'i phyir glo bur ba'i sems la brten nas 'jug go //
translated: Moreover, since it is generated by the power of unreal imagination, it operates in dependence on a mind that is adventitious.

original: de las byung ba'i las dang skye ba brgyud pa las byung ba'i 'khor ba skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de las byung ba'i las dang skye ba brgyud pa las byung ba'i 'khor ba skye bar 'gyur te /

analyzed: de nyid sems yin te don dam par rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba glo bur ma yin pa yang dag pa ma yin pa'i kun tu rtog pa las byung ba /
translated: That is mind, which is ultimately luminous by nature and not adventitious. It arises from unreal imagination.

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa la sogs pa gnyis su sgro 'dogs pa'i mngon par zhen pa'i bag chags kyis stong pa gnyis su med pa'i rang bzhin glo bur ba'i nyes pa las grol ba gnas gyur pa la rnam par byang ba zhes brjod do //
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa la sogs pa gnyis su sgro 'dogs pa'i mngon par zhen pa'i bag chags kyis stong pa gnyis su med pa'i rang bzhin glo bur ba'i nyes pa las grol ba gnas gyur pa la rnam par byang ba zhes brjod do //
translated: The transformation of the mind is called ‚Äúpurification‚Äù because it is empty of the latent tendencies of the exaggerated adherence to the duality of the apprehended and the apprehender, and so forth, and it is free from adventitious faults.

original: de'i phyir de ltar na kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba dag yod par gyur pa'i dngos po'i sems med par rnam par gzhag pa mi 'thad do zhes sems te /

original: 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa yang sems kyi chos yin pa'i phyir la ;
analyzed: 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa yang sems kyi chos yin pa'i phyir la ;
translated: This is because samsara and nirvana are also phenomena of the mind,

original: sems nyid kun nas nyon mongs shing sems nyid rnam par byang ba'o zhes pa'i tshig las so //
analyzed: sems nyid kun nas nyon mongs shing sems nyid rnam par byang ba'o zhes pa'i tshig las so //
translated: and because of the statement, ‚ÄúThe mind itself is afflicted and the mind itself is purified.‚Äù

original: de ltar na 'di ni gzhan gyi 'dod par nges par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: de ltar na 'di ni gzhan gyi 'dod par nges par byed pa yin te /
translated: Thus, this is the ascertainment of the assertions of others.

original: dngos po nyid yang dag par gyur pa'i dngos po'i sems nyid la brten pa gang yin pa zhes /
analyzed: dngos po nyid yang dag par gyur pa'i dngos po'i sems nyid la brten pa gang yin pa zhes /
translated: ‚ÄúThe mind itself is the thing that is the real thing.‚Äù

original: gal te zhes te dngos rten pa //üîΩzhes 'khor ba rnam par 'jig par byed do zhe na /üîΩde'i tshe 'khor ba gzhan du 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te zhes te dngos rten pa // zhes 'khor ba rnam par 'jig par byed do zhe na / de'i tshe 'khor ba gzhan du 'gyur te /
translated: If it is other than mind, it is not tenable that samsara is beginningless.

original: sems las gzhan yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems las gzhan yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is other than mind, then samsara would be other than mind.üîΩIf it is other than entity, it is not tenable that samsara is beginningless.

analyzed: dngos po las gzhan yin na dngos po med par 'gyur te /

original: sems nyid dngos po yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems nyid dngos po yin pa'i phyir ro //

original: ci lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: ci lta bu zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: mkha' 'drar te nam mkha' bzhin du'o //
analyzed: mkha' 'drar te nam mkha' bzhin du'o //
translated: Like space.

original: 'di skad du gang 'di sems la rten pa la 'khor ba zhes brjod na de ci dngos po yin nam dngos po med pa yin /
analyzed: 'di skad du gang 'di sems la rten pa la 'khor ba zhes brjod na de ci dngos po yin nam dngos po med pa yin /

original: dngos po yin na yang sems yin nam de las gzhan yin /
analyzed: dngos po yin na yang sems yin nam de las gzhan yin /

analyzed: de la gal te dngos po sems nyid yin na de'i tshe sems las 'khor ba gzhan ma yin te /
translated: If it is an entity that is mind itself, then at that time samsara is not other than mind.

original: de la brten pa ni sems nyid yin no //
analyzed: de la brten pa ni sems nyid yin no //
translated: That which is dependent on it is mind itself.

original: sems de yang rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba yin pa'i phyir rnam par byang ba'i rang bzhin yin pas spang bar bya ba ma yin la /
analyzed: sems de yang rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba yin pa'i phyir rnam par byang ba'i rang bzhin yin pas spang bar bya ba ma yin la /
translated: And since that mind is naturally luminous, it is by nature pure and not to be abandoned.

original: 'on te sems las gzhan yin na de'i tshe sems las tha dad pa gzhan khas blangs pas grub mtha' nyams pa yin no //üîΩ'on te dngos po @210a * //
analyzed: 'on te sems las gzhan yin na de'i tshe sems las tha dad pa gzhan khas blangs pas grub mtha' nyams pa yin no // 'on te dngos po @210a * //
translated: But if it is other than the mind, then since you accept it to be different from the mind, your tenet system is undermined.

original: med pa yin na de'i tshe 'khor ba zhes pa cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: med pa yin na de'i tshe 'khor ba zhes pa cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin te /

analyzed: ri bong gi rva bzhin no //

original: de nyid kyi phyir mkha' 'drar 'gyur //üîΩzhes gsungs te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir mkha' 'drar 'gyur // zhes gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, it would be like space.

original: dper na nam mkha' rtags su yod pa tsam ni med pa'i dngos pos cung zad kyang don byed nus pa yod pa ma yin te ;
analyzed: dper na nam mkha' rtags su yod pa tsam ni med pa'i dngos pos cung zad kyang don byed nus pa yod pa ma yin te ;

analyzed: de bzhin du khyed kyi 'khor ba yang yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: and in the same way, your cyclic existence would be like that.

analyzed: yang na mkha' 'drar 'gyur zhes pa ni rang bzhin med pa yin pa'i phyir kho bo cag gi grub pa'i mthar zhugs pa yin no zhes brjod par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, we are in accord with the tenets of the Madhyamaka.

original: de lta yin na yang gal te yang dngos po yin du chug mod /
analyzed: de lta yin na yang gal te yang dngos po yin du chug mod /
translated: Even if this were so, one might say, ‚ÄúGranted, it is a thing.

analyzed: de lta na yang yod pa'i dngos por gyur pa'i sems la brten pas de don byed nus par 'gyur ro zhe na /

analyzed: dngos med dngos la brten pas zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /

analyzed: med pa'i rang bzhin ni 'ga' zhig la yang brten par rigs pa ma yin te /

analyzed: rten dang brten pa'i dngos po ni rgyu dang 'bras bu'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: dngos po med pa ni gang gi yang 'bras bu ma yin te / bskyed par bya ba ma yin par khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //

original: de lta yin du chug ste /
analyzed: de lta yin du chug ste /

original: de lta na yang dngos po la brten pas te /
analyzed: de lta na yang dngos po la brten pas te /
translated: Even if this were so, one might say, ‚ÄúIt is based on a thing.

original: dngos po yod par gyur pa'i sems la brten pas dngos po med pa'i bdag nyid byed pa dang ldan pa don byed pa nyid du ji ltar 'gyur te /
analyzed: dngos po yod par gyur pa'i sems la brten pas dngos po med pa'i bdag nyid byed pa dang ldan pa don byed pa nyid du ji ltar 'gyur te /

analyzed: gzhan du na de dngos po yod par 'gyur te nus pa ni dngos po'i mtshan nyid yin la /

analyzed: nus pa thams cad dang bral ba ni dngos po med pa'i mtshan nyid yin no zhes pa'i tshig las so //

analyzed: da ni shin tu dpyad pa na khyed la ci zhig gnas par 'gyur zhe na /

analyzed: khyod kyi sems ni grogs med pa //

original: zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /

analyzed: med pa nyid dngos po dang bral ba 'di'i grogs yin pas grogs po med pa yin te /

original: ni zhes pa nges par gzung bas so //
analyzed: ni zhes pa nges par gzung bas so //

original: khyed sems gcig pu don dam par smra bas gcig pu nyid de /
analyzed: khyed sems gcig pu don dam par smra bas gcig pu nyid de /
translated: Since you, who propound that the mind alone is ultimate, are alone, you are not a pair.

original: gnyis ma yin pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: gnyis ma yin pa nyid yin no //

analyzed: ci ste gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam pa dang bral ba gnyis su med pa'i mtshan nyid kyi sems su brjod pa /

analyzed: de ltar na sems gcig nyid du bsgrubs pas kho bo cag cung zad kyang mi 'dod pa ma yin no zhe na /

original: de ni @210b rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni @210b rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: This is not logical.üîΩThe point is to abandon afflictions, and that is done by describing things.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa spang ba'i ched du dngos po nyid brjod pa yin la de sems gcig pu nyid yod par gyur pa de lta na yang gnod par byed pa las grol ba ma yin no zhes /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa spang ba'i ched du dngos po nyid brjod pa yin la de sems gcig pu nyid yod par gyur pa de lta na yang gnod par byed pa las grol ba ma yin no zhes /
translated: Even if mind were to exist as a single entity, it would not be free from the afflictions.üîΩAs it is said:

original: gang tshe sems ni gzung bral ba //
analyzed: gang tshe sems ni gzung bral ba //
translated: When the mind is free from objects,

original: zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: and so on.

original: gzung ba zhes pa ni nye bar mtshon pa yin te /
analyzed: gzung ba zhes pa ni nye bar mtshon pa yin te /

original: 'dzin pa la sogs pa dang bral ba yang rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dzin pa la sogs pa dang bral ba yang rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that it is also free from subjects and so on.

original: yang na gzung ba la sogs pa la rag las pa ni 'dzin pa yin no zhes pas de dang bral ba'i phyir 'dzin pa med pa yin la /
analyzed: yang na gzung ba la sogs pa la rag las pa ni 'dzin pa yin no zhes pas de dang bral ba'i phyir 'dzin pa med pa yin la /
translated: Alternatively, since the subject is dependent on objects and so on, it is said to be nonexistent because it is free from them.

analyzed: 'dzin pa med na yang des nye bar brtags pa'i mngon par brjod pa med pas brjod par bya ba med do zhes bstan pa'i phyir gzung bral ba zhes brjod pa yin no //

original: gzung ba la sogs pa dang bral ba gnyis su med pa'i rang bzhin gang gi tshe 'gro ba thams cad kyi sems yin pa de'i tshe de'i sems su sems can thams cad kyi rgyud nang du 'dus pa'i phyir 'khor ba'i sems can thams cad kyis de bzhin gshegs
analyzed: gzung ba la sogs pa dang bral ba gnyis su med pa'i rang bzhin gang gi tshe 'gro ba thams cad kyi sems yin pa de'i tshe de'i sems su sems can thams cad kyi rgyud nang du 'dus pa'i phyir 'khor ba'i sems can thams cad kyis de bzhin gshegs
translated: When the nature of non-duality, free from the apprehended and so on, is the mind of all transmigrating beings, then at that time, since the mind of all sentient beings is included within that mind, all sentient beings of cyclic existence areüîΩthus-gone.

original: te / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das nyid thob la /
analyzed: te / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das nyid thob la /
translated: The BhagavƒÅn Buddha himself is attained.

original: 'ga' yang so so'i skye bor mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'ga' yang so so'i skye bor mi 'gyur te /
translated: And no one would be an ordinary being.

original: de'i phyir yang kun nas nyon mongs pa spang ba'i ched du gzhan lam bsgom pa don med par thal la /
analyzed: de'i phyir yang kun nas nyon mongs pa spang ba'i ched du gzhan lam bsgom pa don med par thal la /
translated: Therefore, it follows that the cultivation of other paths for the purpose of abandoning afflictions is meaningless.

original: de ltar yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de ltar yang ma yin te /
translated: But that is not the case.

analyzed: de lta bas na gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dang bral ba yod na yang dngos po la mngon par zhen pa de bzhin du gnas pas nyon mongs pa spang bar mi 'gyur ro zhes dgongs nas /

original: de ltar na yang zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de ltar na yang zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /

original: de ltar zhes pa ni tshig phrad sdud pa yin la de ltar yin na yang don 'di la yang zhes te 'ang gi don to //
analyzed: de ltar zhes pa ni tshig phrad sdud pa yin la de ltar yin na yang don 'di la yang zhes te 'ang gi don to //
translated: ‚ÄúEven though that is so‚Äù is a conjunction that means ‚Äúeven though that is the case, this meaning is also so.‚Äù

original: de ltar khas blangs na yang yon tan ci zhig yod de /
analyzed: de ltar khas blangs na yang yon tan ci zhig yod de /
translated: What is the benefit of accepting that?

original: cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin te /

original: de ltar na ci zhig 'thob par 'gyur zhe na /

original: 'khor bar gnas pa grub pa ni //
analyzed: 'khor bar gnas pa grub pa ni //

original: zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes gsungs te /

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /

analyzed: sdug bsngal can gyi don du ste /

original: 'di yang / sdug bsngal nye bar zhi don du //

analyzed: gang gi ngo bos shes pa'i gzung bar bya ba'i yul de rtag tu nye ba ma yin pas na thal bar 'gyur ba brjod pa'i nyes pa ji ltar mi 'gyur /
translated: Since the object that is the apprehended object of consciousness is not always present, how could the fault of the consequence stated not arise?

original: sgra ji ltar rtag tu yod pa ma yin par gzhung mangs pa'i 'jigs pas ma brjod do //
analyzed: sgra ji ltar rtag tu yod pa ma yin par gzhung mangs pa'i 'jigs pas ma brjod do //
translated: Since it is feared that the text would become too long, I will not explain how sound is not always present.

original: gzhan yang gal te sgra shes pa nyid bdag yin na de'i tshe 'dzin pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir de gzugs la 'dzin par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan yang gal te sgra shes pa nyid bdag yin na de'i tshe 'dzin pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir de gzugs la 'dzin par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Moreover, if the cognition of sound itself were the self, then because it would have the nature of the apprehender, it would not apprehend form.

original: de ni yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni yod pa ma yin te /
translated: That is not the case.

original: gang gi phyir de nyid gzugs 'dzin par 'dod do zhe na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de nyid gzugs 'dzin par 'dod do zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is asserted that it itself apprehends form,

original: 'di la de nyid kyis zhes pa la sogs pa @229b gsungs te /
analyzed: 'di la de nyid kyis zhes pa la sogs pa @229b gsungs te /
translated: in response to that, ≈öubhagupta says, ‚ÄúIn that case, it would not be sound.‚Äù

original: de nyid ni sgra'i shes pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: de nyid ni sgra'i shes pa nyid yin te /
translated: That itself is the cognition of sound.

original: gal te gzugs shes par 'dod na de'i tshe thos pa yang ci ste min /
analyzed: gal te gzugs shes par 'dod na de'i tshe thos pa yang ci ste min /
translated: If it is asserted that it is the cognition of form, then in that case, why is it not also hearing?

original: de'i tshe ste gzugs 'dzin pa'i dus na ci ste thos pa ma yin /
analyzed: de'i tshe ste gzugs 'dzin pa'i dus na ci ste thos pa ma yin /
translated: At that time, that is, when it apprehends form, why is it not hearing?

original: sgra yang ci'i phyir na mi 'dzin te /
analyzed: sgra yang ci'i phyir na mi 'dzin te /
translated: Why does it not also apprehend sound?

original: sgra'i shes pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgra'i shes pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the consciousness of sound.

original: 'on te sgra mi nye ba de'i phyir na de'i shes pa ste sgra de'i shes pa yang med cing yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'on te sgra mi nye ba de'i phyir na de'i shes pa ste sgra de'i shes pa yang med cing yod pa ma yin te /
translated: But if sound is not present, then the consciousness of that, the consciousness of that sound, also does not exist.

original: 'di ltar sgra'i shes pa nyid du de mi 'gyur ro zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: 'di ltar sgra'i shes pa nyid du de mi 'gyur ro zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The point is that it would not be the consciousness of sound.

original: gzhan yang gal te sgra'i shes pa yin na de'i tshe gzugs 'dzin pa'i bdag nyid mi 'thad do zhes bstan pa'i phyir sgra 'dzin zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gzhan yang gal te sgra'i shes pa yin na de'i tshe gzugs 'dzin pa'i bdag nyid mi 'thad do zhes bstan pa'i phyir sgra 'dzin zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Moreover, if it is the consciousness of sound, then it is untenable that it has the nature of apprehending form. To demonstrate this, he says, ‚ÄúThe nature of apprehending sound,‚Äù and so on.

original: sgra 'dzin rang bzhin ni sgra 'dzin pa'i rang gi ngo bo yin te /
analyzed: sgra 'dzin rang bzhin ni sgra 'dzin pa'i rang gi ngo bo yin te /
translated: The nature of apprehending sound is the essence of apprehending sound.

original: sgra'i 'dzin pa po zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: sgra'i 'dzin pa po zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is a synonym for the apprehender of sound.

original: gang zhig shes pa de sgra 'dzin pa gzugs 'dzin pa'i bdag nyid du ji ltar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang zhig shes pa de sgra 'dzin pa gzugs 'dzin pa'i bdag nyid du ji ltar 'gyur te /
translated: How could that consciousness, which is the apprehender of sound, be the nature of the apprehender of form?

original: cung zad kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: cung zad kyang ma yin te /
translated: It could not be in the slightest,

original: cha shas med pa gcig la gzugs gnyis mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: cha shas med pa gcig la gzugs gnyis mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is illogical for a single partless entity to have two forms.

original: ci ste dper na gcig 'ga' zhig la ltos nas pha yin la ;
analyzed: ci ste dper na gcig 'ga' zhig la ltos nas pha yin la ;
translated: If one is a father in dependence on some other, that one is not a father in his own right.

original: 'ga' zhig la ltos te /
analyzed: 'ga' zhig la ltos te /
translated: In relation to some,

original: de nyid du bu yin par 'gyur la /
analyzed: de nyid du bu yin par 'gyur la /

original: de bzhin du skabs su bab pa la yang gzugs gnyis po dag gcig tu 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: de bzhin du skabs su bab pa la yang gzugs gnyis po dag gcig tu 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: In the same way, in the present context, the two forms would be one.

original: gcig ni pha dang zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gcig ni pha dang zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: One is the father, and so on.

original: gcig kho na pha yin te skyed pa po yin la bu yang bskyed par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: gcig kho na pha yin te skyed pa po yin la bu yang bskyed par bya ba yin te /
translated: Only one is the father, the progenitor, and the son is the one to be procreated.

original: de nyid 'di yin zhes pa ni brtags pa yin no //
analyzed: de nyid 'di yin zhes pa ni brtags pa yin no //

original: de yang de la ltos pa ni brtags par rnam par gzhag par bya ste /
analyzed: de yang de la ltos pa ni brtags par rnam par gzhag par bya ste /
translated: Moreover, that is posited as a misconception.

original: yang dag nyid min de don dam pa ma yin la /
analyzed: yang dag nyid min de don dam pa ma yin la /
translated: It is not real, it is not ultimate.

original: gcig gi rang bzhin nyid gnyi ga'i rang bzhin du rtogs pa'i sgro btags pa yin te gzugs tha dad pas yang gcig nyid de bzhin du sgra sna tshogs par sgra sna tshogs kyis brjod par bya ba min no //
analyzed: gcig gi rang bzhin nyid gnyi ga'i rang bzhin du rtogs pa'i sgro btags pa yin te gzugs tha dad pas yang gcig nyid de bzhin du sgra sna tshogs par sgra sna tshogs kyis brjod par bya ba min no //
translated: The nature of one is imagined to be the nature of both. Because of the difference in form, one is like that. Sound is not to be expressed by various sounds.

original: dngos po pa'i rang bzhin gnyis gcig tu sbyar bar bya ba yin la /
analyzed: dngos po pa'i rang bzhin gnyis gcig tu sbyar bar bya ba yin la /
translated: The nature of the two things is to be applied as one.

original: de yang nam yang rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de yang nam yang rigs pa ma yin no //

original: rang bzhin gnyis tha dad pa yin pas dngos po yang gnyis su thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rang bzhin gnyis tha dad pa yin pas dngos po yang gnyis su thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Since the two natures are different, it follows that the thing would be twofold.

original: de lta bas na ji ltar dngos po gcig gnyis yin pa la dpe'i chos can yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na ji ltar dngos po gcig gnyis yin pa la dpe'i chos can yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Thus, just as one thing is twofold, the example does not exist.

original: gang yang brtags pas yod pa de ni skabs su bab pa la mkho ba ma yin te //
analyzed: gang yang brtags pas yod pa de ni skabs su bab pa la mkho ba ma yin te //
translated: And that which is imputed to exist is not relevant to the present context.

original: 'di ni cung zad kyang ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni cung zad kyang ma yin no //
translated: This is not the case at all.

original: 'di'i phyir yang 'di don dam par ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di'i phyir yang 'di don dam par ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that this is not the case ultimately, he says:

original: 'di ltar snying stobs zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /üîΩ'di yang khyod kyis khas @230a * //
analyzed: 'di ltar snying stobs zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te / 'di yang khyod kyis khas @230a * //
translated: Thus, sattva, etc.

original: blang bar bya ste /
analyzed: blang bar bya ste /
translated: This also should be accepted by you.

original: grangs can gyi gzhung lugs kyis 'gro ba yon tan gsum gyi bdag nyid yin la /
analyzed: grangs can gyi gzhung lugs kyis 'gro ba yon tan gsum gyi bdag nyid yin la /
translated: According to the Samkhya system, the world is of the nature of the three gunas.

original: de'i phyir snying stobs dang rdul dang mun pa yang zhes tshig phrad bsdus pa ni sdud pa'i don to //
analyzed: de'i phyir snying stobs dang rdul dang mun pa yang zhes tshig phrad bsdus pa ni sdud pa'i don to //
translated: Therefore, sattva, rajas, and tamas are also, the condensed expression of the words is for the purpose of inclusion.

original: 'di ltar zhes te gang gi phyir yon tan 'di rnams rang gi ngo bos gnas pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes te gang gi phyir yon tan 'di rnams rang gi ngo bos gnas pa yin te /
translated: Thus, because these qualities exist by their own nature,

original: so sor ram bsdus nas so //
analyzed: so sor ram bsdus nas so //
translated: either individually or collectively,

original: de lta bas na don dam par pha yang ma yin la /
analyzed: de lta bas na don dam par pha yang ma yin la /
translated: therefore, ultimately, there is no father,

original: bu yang ma yin te /
analyzed: bu yang ma yin te /
translated: and there is no son.

original: thams cad du yon tan gcig kho nar yod pa yin no //
analyzed: thams cad du yon tan gcig kho nar yod pa yin no //
translated: Everywhere, the quality exists as one and the same.

original: don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: don ni 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning is this:

analyzed: bu'i gnas skabs na gang zhig snying stobs dang rdul dang mun pa'i mtshan nyid kyis yon tan de nyid skyed par byed pa'i dngos por yang 'gyur te /

original: des na snga ma dang phyi ma'i dus dag tu khyad par med pa'i dngos po yin no //
analyzed: des na snga ma dang phyi ma'i dus dag tu khyad par med pa'i dngos po yin no //

original: de lta bas na de la ltos nas pha dang bu ru brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: de lta bas na de la ltos nas pha dang bu ru brjod par bya ste /

original: de la khyad par ni yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de la khyad par ni yod pa ma yin no //

original: de lta bas na 'di ni rtag pa nyid kyi tha snyad yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na 'di ni rtag pa nyid kyi tha snyad yin no //
translated: Therefore, this is the convention of permanence.

original: gal te yang gzugs 'dzin pa'i dus na yang sgra 'dzin pa'i shes pa de gcig nyid yin na de'i tshe de'i rang bzhin dmigs par 'gyur na dmigs pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: gal te yang gzugs 'dzin pa'i dus na yang sgra 'dzin pa'i shes pa de gcig nyid yin na de'i tshe de'i rang bzhin dmigs par 'gyur na dmigs pa yang ma yin no //

analyzed: de lta bas na de 'dzin pa'i bdag nyid ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /

original: de ni sgra 'dzin zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de ni sgra 'dzin zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /

analyzed: sgra 'dzin dang ldan pa ni 'brel ba yin la ni'i sgras ni khyad par brjod pa yin no //
translated: That which is associated with the apprehension of sound is related to it. The word ‚Äúnot‚Äù expresses an exclusion.

original: rang bzhin de ni gzugs 'dzin pa po yin te /
analyzed: rang bzhin de ni gzugs 'dzin pa po yin te /
translated: That nature is the apprehender of form.

original: shes pa de mthong ba ma yin te /
analyzed: shes pa de mthong ba ma yin te /
translated: That consciousness is not seen,

original: rtogs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rtogs pa ma yin no //
translated: it is not realized.

original: de'i phyir de'i tshe sgra 'dzin pa'i bdag nyid de yod pa ma yin no zhes nges par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir de'i tshe sgra 'dzin pa'i bdag nyid de yod pa ma yin no zhes nges par bya'o //

analyzed: de ltar na ji ltar gzugs 'dzin par 'gyur zhe na /

original: de nyid ces pa la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de nyid ces pa la sogs pa smos te /

translated: That itself is the cognition of sound, and the nature of another‚Äôs form is the nature of apprehending form.

original: de ji lta bur chos mthun pas chos mthun pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: de ji lta bur chos mthun pas chos mthun pa yin zhe na /

analyzed: gar mkhan lta bu zhes te / ji ltar gzhan gar gyi dus na gar gyi sa gzhir song ste /
translated: It is like an actor.

original: gar mkhan gcig pu nyid sna tshogs pa'i gzugs kyis 'jug pa de bzhin du skabs su bab pa la yang nyes pa med do zhe na /
analyzed: gar mkhan gcig pu nyid sna tshogs pa'i gzugs kyis 'jug pa de bzhin du skabs su bab pa la yang nyes pa med do zhe na /
translated: Just as at the time of another‚Äôs dance, having gone to the stage of the dance, the single actor engages in various forms, so too in the present case there is no fault.

original: 'di la brjod pa /
analyzed: 'di la brjod pa /
translated: To this it is said:

original: de yang rtag pa min te zhes te /
analyzed: de yang rtag pa min te zhes te /

original: mi rtag pa yin la snga ma'i @230b rang bzhin yongs su dor nas ngo bo gzhan thob pa yin no //
analyzed: mi rtag pa yin la snga ma'i @230b rang bzhin yongs su dor nas ngo bo gzhan thob pa yin no //

original: snga ma dang phyi ma dag rang bzhin gcig pa nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: snga ma dang phyi ma dag rang bzhin gcig pa nyid ma yin te /
translated: The previous and later are not the same in nature.

original: gar mkhan sna tshogs pa'i gzugs yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gar mkhan sna tshogs pa'i gzugs yin pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: gzhan du na de'i gzugs gnyis po yang gcig tu sems la snang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, both of its forms would appear to the mind as one.

original: de'i phyir bsgrub bya med pa'i dpe ltar snang ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir bsgrub bya med pa'i dpe ltar snang ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is a mere semblance of an example, since the probandum is absent.

original: 'on te de lta na yang dngos po de de nyid kyi rang bzhin slar yang gzhan dang gzhan du skye zhing 'gag pa des na nyes pa 'di med do zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te de lta na yang dngos po de de nyid kyi rang bzhin slar yang gzhan dang gzhan du skye zhing 'gag pa des na nyes pa 'di med do zhe na /
translated: But even if that is so, since that entity itself is born and ceases again and again in a different nature, this fault does not exist.

original: 'di la gal te tshul gzhan zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: 'di la gal te tshul gzhan zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: In response to this, NƒÅgƒÅrjuna explains, ‚ÄúIf you say that it is a different mode,‚Äù and so on.

original: de nyid ni bdag gam gar mkhan no //üîΩtshul gzhan ni rang bzhin gzhan yin par gal te brjod na'o //
analyzed: de nyid ni bdag gam gar mkhan no // tshul gzhan ni rang bzhin gzhan yin par gal te brjod na'o //
translated: ‚Äú That itself‚Äù refers to the self or the dancer.

original: de'i tshe gcig pu 'di nyid sngon med pa ste /
analyzed: de'i tshe gcig pu 'di nyid sngon med pa ste /
translated: If you say that ‚Äúa different mode‚Äù is a different nature, then this one alone is unprecedented.

original: 'di ni sngar ma byung ba sngar ma mthong ba 'di lta bu'i gcig pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni sngar ma byung ba sngar ma mthong ba 'di lta bu'i gcig pa yin no //
translated: This one has not occurred before, this one has not been seen before, this one is unprecedented.

original: de'i dngos po gzhan skyes pa na yang gcig pa nyid yin zhing tha mi dad pa'i bdag nyid yin na 'di ltar de nyid 'di yin no zhes pa dang / yang gzhan gyi ngo bo yin no zhes de nyid gzhan nyid yin par brjod na phan tshun 'gal ba'i chos gnyis po 'di gcig rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i dngos po gzhan skyes pa na yang gcig pa nyid yin zhing tha mi dad pa'i bdag nyid yin na 'di ltar de nyid 'di yin no zhes pa dang / yang gzhan gyi ngo bo yin no zhes de nyid gzhan nyid yin par brjod na phan tshun 'gal ba'i chos gnyis po 'di gcig rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: If the thing is different from that, and is the same and not different from it, then it is said that ‚Äúthat is this,‚Äù and also that ‚Äúit is different.‚Äù But it is not logical for two mutually exclusive properties to be in one thing.

original: gang gis de skye ba dang 'gag par 'gyur ba na yang dngos po la de dag mi 'gyur ba dngos po zhes bya ba rang bzhin ngo bo las gzhan ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gis de skye ba dang 'gag par 'gyur ba na yang dngos po la de dag mi 'gyur ba dngos po zhes bya ba rang bzhin ngo bo las gzhan ma yin no //
translated: Since it is not the case that things arise and cease, and that things do not arise and cease, the so-called thing is not different from its intrinsic nature.

original: de tha mi dad pa'i rang bzhin skye ba dang 'gag pa dag gi dngos po de'i gnas skabs su rigs pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de tha mi dad pa'i rang bzhin skye ba dang 'gag pa dag gi dngos po de'i gnas skabs su rigs pa yang ma yin te /
translated: It is not logical that the intrinsic nature of a thing that is not different from it arises and ceases.

original: tha dad pa ma yin pa med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tha dad pa ma yin pa med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //

analyzed: tha dad pa la 'brel pa grub pa ma yin no zhes bsams pa yin no //

analyzed: de ltar gyur na yang gal te bdag 'di rang bzhin gnyis su bden pa yin na thal ba 'dir 'gyur ba ste /

analyzed: 'on kyang 'di'i rang bzhin gnyug ma bor nas gzhan gyi ngo bo de kho na nyid ma yin pa'i phyir /

original: des na thal bar 'gyur ba brjod pa yod pa ma yin no zhes pa'i dogs pas /
analyzed: des na thal bar 'gyur ba brjod pa yod pa ma yin no zhes pa'i dogs pas /
translated: Therefore, since there is no statement of a consequence,

original: gal te tshul zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gal te tshul zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: if it is said, ‚ÄúIn that case, tell us its nature,‚Äù

analyzed: gzhan gyi gzugs de'i yul gyi khyad par can shel gyi rdo bzhin du 'di gcig pa yin no zhes gal te zer na /
translated: and so on, if it is said, ‚ÄúThat other form is its object, and it is singular, like a crystal ball,‚Äù

original: de ltar na de'i rang bzhin smos zhes te /
analyzed: de ltar na de'i rang bzhin smos zhes te /
translated: in that case, tell us its nature.

original: rang bzhin gnyug ma'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin gnyug ma'o //
translated: Its intrinsic nature is its original nature.üîΩTell us, speak of its reality, its essence.

original: de'i bdag gi ngo bo'i de kho na nyid brjod cing smra bar gyis shig / de'i gzugs gzhan yod pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: de'i bdag gi ngo bo'i de kho na nyid brjod cing smra bar gyis shig / de'i gzugs gzhan yod pa nyid yin te /
translated: Its form is the existence of another.

original: de gang zhe na /
analyzed: de gang zhe na /
translated: What is that?

original: shes pa nyid ce na @231a * //
analyzed: shes pa nyid ce na @231a * //
translated: If it is cognition itself,

original: zhes te / shes pa'i bdag nyid de dus snga ma dang phyi ma la rjes su 'gro ba can ni de'i gnyug ma'i rang bzhin can te /
analyzed: zhes te / shes pa'i bdag nyid de dus snga ma dang phyi ma la rjes su 'gro ba can ni de'i gnyug ma'i rang bzhin can te /
translated: Thus, the self is the nature of consciousness, and it is the intrinsic nature of that which is present in the prior and subsequent time periods.

original: gzhan ni ci zhig brjod par bya /üîΩde'i gzugs kyi snga ma dang phyi ma dag tu gzugs gzhan dang 'brel pa na yang shel bzhin du 'di gcig pa yin no zhes gal te zer na'o //
analyzed: gzhan ni ci zhig brjod par bya / de'i gzugs kyi snga ma dang phyi ma dag tu gzugs gzhan dang 'brel pa na yang shel bzhin du 'di gcig pa yin no zhes gal te zer na'o //

original: de ltar na skyes bu kun gcig tu thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar na skyes bu kun gcig tu thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: If you say that it is the same self because the prior and subsequent forms of the self are related to different forms, like a crystal, then all persons would be the same self.

original: de ltar na de shes pa nyid du thun mong ba'i chos yin pas so //
analyzed: de ltar na de shes pa nyid du thun mong ba'i chos yin pas so //

original: dper na snga ma dang phyi ma'i dus kyi sgra dang gzugs kyi shes pa dag de'i rnam pa tha dad pas tha dad pa yin na yang gcig yin pa de ltar na sems can kun te /
analyzed: dper na snga ma dang phyi ma'i dus kyi sgra dang gzugs kyi shes pa dag de'i rnam pa tha dad pas tha dad pa yin na yang gcig yin pa de ltar na sems can kun te /
translated: For example, the consciousness of sound and form in the prior and subsequent time periods are different because their aspects are different, but they are the same.

analyzed: srog chags kyi rgyud du gtogs pa rnams bdag gcig tu thal bar 'gyur ba thob par 'gyur la /

analyzed: dngos po tha dad na yang khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no difference between the two, even though they are different things.

original: de ltar na yang thal ba 'dir 'gyur ba yin te zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar na yang thal ba 'dir 'gyur ba yin te zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that this consequence is still applicable,

original: sems dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: sems dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /

analyzed: gal te bar skabs kyi tha dad pa'i rgyu mtshan gyi khyad par spangs nas rnam pa cung zhig la brten nas gcig tu brjod nas /
translated: If, having abandoned the difference that is the reason for the interval, one speaks of them as one, based on some similarity,

analyzed: de'i tshe sems dang ldan pa skyes bu'i chos dang sems med pa'i rang bzhin gyi chos so //

analyzed: kyang gi sgras ni nyes pa gzhan sdud pa yin te /
translated: would also be one. The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù includes other faults.

analyzed: de rnams kyang gcig cing tha dad pa med pa'i dngos por 'gyur ro //
translated: They would also be one and not different things.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /

original: sems dang ldan pa dang / mi ldan pa de dag gang gi phyir te rgyu mtshan gang gis yod pa ste /
analyzed: sems dang ldan pa dang / mi ldan pa de dag gang gi phyir te rgyu mtshan gang gis yod pa ste /

analyzed: bdog pa de yang dngos po rnams kyi gnyug ma'i gzugs su mtshungs pa ste gnyis po dang 'dra ba yin no //
translated: Moreover, that which is possessed is similar to the intrinsic reality of things, that is, it is like the two.

original: ci ste 'di la yang dngos po tha dad na yang 'dra ba'i rgyu mtshan gyis gcig pa nyid yin te de lta bas na gang 'dod pa'i dngos po bsgrubs pas nyes pa med do zhe na /

original: gang tshe bye brag ces pa la sogs pa smos te /

original: bye brag ni tha dad pa'i dngos po thams cad nges pa med pas gang gi tshe log pa yin zhing mi bden pa gnyug ma'i gzugs yin pa de'i tshe 'dra ba'i rten gang yin te /
analyzed: bye brag ni tha dad pa'i dngos po thams cad nges pa med pas gang gi tshe log pa yin zhing mi bden pa gnyug ma'i gzugs yin pa de'i tshe 'dra ba'i rten gang yin te /
translated: Since all things that are different are uncertain, when there is no difference, and there is no intrinsic reality that is not false, then what is the basis of similarity?

original: gang la brten nas 'dra bar rnam par gzhag par byed /
analyzed: gang la brten nas 'dra bar rnam par gzhag par byed /

original: khyad par yod na yang chos mthun pa cung zad tsam gyis 'dra bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: khyad par yod na yang chos mthun pa cung zad tsam gyis 'dra bar 'gyur ro //

original: khyad par med na yang de nyid du 'gyur la /
analyzed: khyad par med na yang de nyid du 'gyur la /

original: 'dra ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dra ba ni ma yin te /

analyzed: ba lang dad pa min dag la khyad @231b par nyams su myong ba med na ba men ba lang dang 'dra bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: because if there were no difference in the experience of a cow and a gayal, then a gayal would not be similar to a cow.

original: 'on kyang ba lang nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'on kyang ba lang nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: But it would be a cow.üîΩTherefore, the difference itself is the basis of similarity.

original: de'i phyir bye brag nyid 'dra ba'i rten yin la de yang gang gi tshe don dam par mi 'gyur na /
analyzed: de'i phyir bye brag nyid 'dra ba'i rten yin la de yang gang gi tshe don dam par mi 'gyur na /

original: de'i tshe gang 'dra bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i tshe gang 'dra bar 'gyur te /
translated: In what way would it be similar?

original: mtshungs pa'i rnam pa nyid skyes bu'ang gzhan dag la brten pa'i rgyu mtshan du gyur pa cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin no zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: mtshungs pa'i rnam pa nyid skyes bu'ang gzhan dag la brten pa'i rgyu mtshan du gyur pa cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin no zhes pa'i don to //

original: de'i phyir dngos po la gcig nyid du 'gyur ba yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir dngos po la gcig nyid du 'gyur ba yin te /
translated: Therefore, things would be identical.

original: khyed kyi 'dra bas byas pa ni ma yin la /
analyzed: khyed kyi 'dra bas byas pa ni ma yin la /
translated: It is not that similarity is produced by you.üîΩHow could it be established?

original: de ji ltar na grub pa la sgrub pa'i phyir nyes pa med do zhes rjod par byed /
analyzed: de ji ltar na grub pa la sgrub pa'i phyir nyes pa med do zhes rjod par byed /
translated: Therefore, how could it be that there is no fault because it is established by that which is established?

analyzed: de bzhin du ser skya pa dang / rgyal dpog pas yongs su brtags pa'i sems kyi rang bzhin gyi bdag yod par ma grub po //
translated: Likewise, the self that is the nature of mind imputed by the followers of Kapila and Jaimini does not exist.

original: rig byed kyi mtha' gsang bar smra bas brtags pa la yang ji ltar srid pas sun dbyung ba brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: rig byed kyi mtha' gsang bar smra bas brtags pa la yang ji ltar srid pas sun dbyung ba brjod par bya'o //
translated: And the one imputed by the VedƒÅntins should be criticized in whatever way is appropriate.

original: da ni rigs pa can la sogs pas brtags pa'i sems med pa'i bdag gi yod pa'i tha snyad dgag pa'i ched du sems med pa yang zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: da ni rigs pa can la sogs pas brtags pa'i sems med pa'i bdag gi yod pa'i tha snyad dgag pa'i ched du sems med pa yang zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Now, in order to refute the convention of a self that is mindless, imputed by the NaiyƒÅyikas and so on, ‚ÄúMindless‚Äù and so on is stated.

original: sems dang ldan pa'i bdag re zhig brjod pa'i rigs pa mi 'thad la /
analyzed: sems dang ldan pa'i bdag re zhig brjod pa'i rigs pa mi 'thad la /
translated: First, it is not tenable to state that the self is endowed with mind.

original: sems med kyang bdag ma yin par bstan pa'i ched du min te zhes te /
analyzed: sems med kyang bdag ma yin par bstan pa'i ched du min te zhes te /
translated: In order to teach that even if it is mindless, it is not a self, ‚ÄúIt is not‚Äù is stated.

original: mi rigs so zhes pa ni 'ang gi sgra'i don te /
analyzed: mi rigs so zhes pa ni 'ang gi sgra'i don te /
translated: ‚ÄúIt is not tenable‚Äù is the meaning of the word ‚Äúalso.‚Äù

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: sems med phyir te /
analyzed: sems med phyir te /
translated: Because it is mindless.

original: sems dang mi ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems dang mi ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not endowed with mind.

original: sems med pa gang gi yin pa de ni sems med pa'o //
analyzed: sems med pa gang gi yin pa de ni sems med pa'o //

original: de lta bas na sems med pa de'i phyir zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: de lta bas na sems med pa de'i phyir zhes pa'i don to //
translated: Therefore, because it is mindless, that is the meaning of ‚Äúbecause of that.‚Äù

original: ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is it like?

original: snam sogs bzhin zhes te /
analyzed: snam sogs bzhin zhes te /
translated: Like cloth, etc.

original: ji ltar snam bu dang / shing dang ri la sogs pa rnams sems dang bral ba'i phyir bdag ma yin pa de bzhin du mngon par 'dod pa yang ste las dang byed pa po la sogs pa rnams su khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ji ltar snam bu dang / shing dang ri la sogs pa rnams sems dang bral ba'i phyir bdag ma yin pa de bzhin du mngon par 'dod pa yang ste las dang byed pa po la sogs pa rnams su khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Just as cloth, wood, mountains, etc. are not the self because they are devoid of mind, so also the things that are asserted, i.e., karma, the agent, etc., are not the self because they are devoid of mind.

original: gzhan du na des cung zad kyang dgos pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan du na des cung zad kyang dgos pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Otherwise, they would not serve any purpose at all.

original: sems med pa yang der rigs pa ma yin to /
analyzed: sems med pa yang der rigs pa ma yin to /

analyzed: dper na snam bu la sogs pa yin no //

original: gal te yang 'di'i rang nyid sems dang ldan pa ma yin pa de ltar na yang blo'i sems kyis sems dang ldan par byed de /
analyzed: gal te yang 'di'i rang nyid sems dang ldan pa ma yin pa de ltar na yang blo'i sems kyis sems dang ldan par byed de /
translated: Even if it is not itself endowed with mind, still it is made to be endowed with mind by the mind of the intellect.üîΩThus, this fault does not exist.üîΩBut if it is endowed with mind,

analyzed: des na nyes pa 'di med ces gzhan gyi bsam pas srid pas 'on te sems dang ldan pa'i phyir /

original: shes na zhes smos te /
analyzed: shes na zhes smos te /
translated: But if it is conscious,

original: 'on te zhes pa ni 'dri ba'o //
analyzed: 'on te zhes pa ni 'dri ba'o //
translated: then it is mind.

original: 'on te bdag 'di sems dang ldan pa'i phyir te /üîΩblo dang 'dul ba las rang nyid sems dang mi @232a * //
analyzed: 'on te bdag 'di sems dang ldan pa'i phyir te / blo dang 'dul ba las rang nyid sems dang mi @232a * //
translated: But if you say that it is because this self has mind,üîΩthen even when it is not associated with mind, it would be known

original: ldan pa na yang shes par 'gyur na'o //
analyzed: ldan pa na yang shes par 'gyur na'o //
translated: through intelligence and discipline.

original: shes par byed pas na shes pa yin no //
analyzed: shes par byed pas na shes pa yin no //

original: de ltar khas len pa na mi shes 'jigs par thal te /
analyzed: de ltar khas len pa na mi shes 'jigs par thal te /

original: gang gi tshe 'di ltar ra ro ba dang brgyal ba la sogs pa'i gnas skabs na sems dang ldan pa log pa na bdag nyid mi shes pa ste /
analyzed: gang gi tshe 'di ltar ra ro ba dang brgyal ba la sogs pa'i gnas skabs na sems dang ldan pa log pa na bdag nyid mi shes pa ste /

analyzed: cung zhig kyang mi shes pa de'i tshe 'jigs par 'gyur te /

analyzed: sngar sems dang ldan pa dang 'brel pa'i rang bzhin yongs su gtong bas yongs su 'jigs par thal bar 'gyur ro //

translated: But if you say that there is no fault because it is the same nature when it is associated with mind and when it is not associated with mind, then to state the opponent‚Äôs position, NƒÅgƒÅrjuna says, ‚ÄúIf the self is the same when associated with mind and when not associated with mind,‚Äù and so on.

original: ci ste sems dang ldan pa skye ba dang 'gag pa dag 'gyur ba med pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: ci ste sems dang ldan pa skye ba dang 'gag pa dag 'gyur ba med pa nyid yin te /

analyzed: ma skyes pa dang ma 'gags pa'i rang bzhin nyid bdag yin no zhes so //

original: gal te de ltar na sems pas de la ci zhig bya ste /
analyzed: gal te de ltar na sems pas de la ci zhig bya ste /

original: sems pa dang bral ba dus thams cad du 'gyur ba med par gnas na /
analyzed: sems pa dang bral ba dus thams cad du 'gyur ba med par gnas na /
translated: If the self is always devoid of mind and abides without changing,

translated: What special purpose is served? None at all.

analyzed: de ltar gnas na yang khyod kyis ci zhig bsgrub pa yin zhes /

original: de ltar sems med ces pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de ltar sems med ces pa la sogs pa gsungs te /

original: mi shes pa ni phan pa dang mi phan pa cung zad kyang shes par mi bya ba yin la /
analyzed: mi shes pa ni phan pa dang mi phan pa cung zad kyang shes par mi bya ba yin la /

analyzed: bya ba dang bral ba ni bya ba las phyi rol du gyur pa yin te /

analyzed: ji ltar rang bzhin med pa nyid kyis bya ba thams cad kyis stong pa la brtags pa tsam gyis nam mkha' bzhin du bdag kyang yin no zhes pa'i @232b don nam /
translated: Just as space is imputed to be empty of all functions due to the absence of intrinsic reality, so too the self is.

original: gzhan gyi 'dod pa yin te /üîΩji ltar las dang byed pa la sogs pa la yin pa'i ngo bo ni nam mkha' yin te /
analyzed: gzhan gyi 'dod pa yin te / ji ltar las dang byed pa la sogs pa la yin pa'i ngo bo ni nam mkha' yin te /

analyzed: sems pa med pa'i phyir dang / bya ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The essence of action and agent and so on is space because it is devoid of mind and devoid of function.

analyzed: da ni yang gzhan du bdag 'gegs par byed pa'i gnod pa bstan par 'dod nas gzhan gyi gzhung lugs dgod pa ni /

original: gal te bdag ni yod min na //
analyzed: gal te bdag ni yod min na //

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /

original: gal te 'jig rten pha rol po 'ga' yang med par 'gyur na /
analyzed: gal te 'jig rten pha rol po 'ga' yang med par 'gyur na /

analyzed: las ni dge ba dang mi dge ba yin la /

original: gang nyid kyis las byas pa de nyid kyis de'i 'bras bu thob pa yin te /
analyzed: gang nyid kyis las byas pa de nyid kyis de'i 'bras bu thob pa yin te /
translated: The one who has done the action obtains the result.

original: gzhan gyis ni ma yin la /
analyzed: gzhan gyis ni ma yin la /
translated: It is not another.

original: de cis 'thad pa yin te /
analyzed: de cis 'thad pa yin te /
translated: How is this tenable?

original: mi rigs shing 'thad pa ma yin no //
analyzed: mi rigs shing 'thad pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not reasonable, it is not tenable.

original: 'jig rten pha rol du las dang 'bras bu 'brel pa ni 'dod pa yang yin no ;
analyzed: 'jig rten pha rol du las dang 'bras bu 'brel pa ni 'dod pa yang yin no ;
translated: The connection between action and result in the next world is accepted.

original: /'di la yang bde bar gshegs pa pa rnams dang yang rtsod pa med do //
analyzed: /'di la yang bde bar gshegs pa pa rnams dang yang rtsod pa med do //
translated: And in this world, there is no dispute with the followers of the Sugata.

original: de ltar yang mdo las /
analyzed: de ltar yang mdo las /
translated: Thus, a sutra declares:

original: 'di nyid kyis byas pa'i las ji ltar gzhan gyis myong bar 'gyur /
analyzed: 'di nyid kyis byas pa'i las ji ltar gzhan gyis myong bar 'gyur /
translated: How could the result of an action done by this person be experienced by another?

original: dge slong dag byas shing bsags pa'i las ni sa'i khams la smin par 'gyur ba ma yin /
analyzed: dge slong dag byas shing bsags pa'i las ni sa'i khams la smin par 'gyur ba ma yin /
translated: Monks, an action that has been done and accumulated will not be experienced in the earth element.

original: chu'i khams la ma yin /
analyzed: chu'i khams la ma yin /
translated: It will not be experienced in the water element,

original: me'i khams la ma yin /
analyzed: me'i khams la ma yin /
translated: the fire element,

original: rlung gi khams la ma yin /
analyzed: rlung gi khams la ma yin /
translated: or the wind element.

original: zin pa'i phung po dang khams dang skye mched 'di nyid la smin pa yin no zhes rgyas par gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: zin pa'i phung po dang khams dang skye mched 'di nyid la smin pa yin no zhes rgyas par gsungs pa yin no //
translated: It ripens on this very appropriated collection of aggregates, elements, and sense bases.

original: yang gsungs pa /
analyzed: yang gsungs pa /
translated: And it is also said:

original: las rnams bskal pa brgyar yang ni //
analyzed: las rnams bskal pa brgyar yang ni //
translated: Karmas do not perish even in one hundred eons.

original: chud mi za zhing tshogs dang dus //
analyzed: chud mi za zhing tshogs dang dus //
translated: When the assemblage and the time are complete,

original: rnyed nas lus can rnams la ni //
analyzed: rnyed nas lus can rnams la ni //
translated: then for embodied beings

original: 'bras bu dag tu nges par 'gyur //
analyzed: 'bras bu dag tu nges par 'gyur //
translated: the fruits are certain.

original: zhes so // de lta bas na las dang 'bras bu 'brel pa khyed kyis kyang spang ba ma yin la /
analyzed: zhes so // de lta bas na las dang 'bras bu 'brel pa khyed kyis kyang spang ba ma yin la /
translated: Therefore, you also do not reject the connection between karma and its effects.

original: de lta bas na nges par bdag khas blang bar bya ste /
analyzed: de lta bas na nges par bdag khas blang bar bya ste /
translated: Therefore, you must definitely accept the self.

original: gzhan du na 'di thams cad mi rigs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan du na 'di thams cad mi rigs par 'gyur te /
translated: Otherwise, all of this would be illogical.

original: bdag med na las dang 'bras bu 'brel par ji ltar 'thad par 'gyur zhes /
analyzed: bdag med na las dang 'bras bu 'brel par ji ltar 'thad par 'gyur zhes /
translated: If there is no self, how could karma and its effects be tenable?

original: las byas nas ni zhes pa la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: las byas nas ni zhes pa la sogs pa smos so //
translated: In response to this, the text says, ‚ÄúHaving performed an action . . . ‚Äù

original: ni'i sgras ni gang gi phyir te /
analyzed: ni'i sgras ni gang gi phyir te /
translated: The word ‚Äúindeed‚Äù means ‚Äúbecause.‚Äù

original: dge ba dang mi dge ba'i mtshan nyid kyi las byas te /
analyzed: dge ba dang mi dge ba'i mtshan nyid kyi las byas te /
translated: Having performed an action that is virtuous or nonvirtuous,

original: las bskyed nas zhig pa na zhes te /
analyzed: las bskyed nas zhig pa na zhes te /
translated: having generated the karma, it perishes.

original: zhig cing las byed pa 'gags pa na 'bras bu ga la 'gyur te /
analyzed: zhig cing las byed pa 'gags pa na 'bras bu ga la 'gyur te /
translated: If it is destroyed and the agent ceases, how could there be an effect?

original: bdag med pa na 'jig rten pha rol du 'gro ba su yang med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag med pa na 'jig rten pha rol du 'gro ba su yang med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because if there is no self, there is no one who goes to another world.

original: gang gi sems @233a * //
analyzed: gang gi sems @233a * //
translated: If the action is done by the mind,

original: kyi skad cig mas byas pa'i las de skad cig ma yin pas de las byas pa'i dus nyid na 'gags pa'i phyir las byas pa'i 'bras bu bde 'gro 'am /
analyzed: kyi skad cig mas byas pa'i las de skad cig ma yin pas de las byas pa'i dus nyid na 'gags pa'i phyir las byas pa'i 'bras bu bde 'gro 'am /
translated: since the action done in a moment is momentary, at the time the action is done, it ceases. Therefore, who would experience the effect of the action, whether it be a happy or a bad rebirth?

original: ngan 'gro la bde ba dang sdug bsngal 'jig rten pa gang gi yin par 'gyur zhing skye bar te /
analyzed: ngan 'gro la bde ba dang sdug bsngal 'jig rten pa gang gi yin par 'gyur zhing skye bar te /
translated: Who would experience the pleasure and pain of the world?

original: gang gi yang ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi yang ma yin no //
translated: No one.

original: 'jig rten pha rol du yang las byas pa nyid kyi 'bras bu dang ldan pa gzhan 'ga' zhig skyes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten pha rol du yang las byas pa nyid kyi 'bras bu dang ldan pa gzhan 'ga' zhig skyes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And in another world, no one would experience the effect of the action done, because another would be born.

original: de ltar na byas pa chud za zhing /
analyzed: de ltar na byas pa chud za zhing /
translated: Thus, what is done would perish,

original: ma byas pa dang phrad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ma byas pa dang phrad par 'gyur ro //
translated: and one would encounter what was not done.

original: 'di ni mtshon pa tsam yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni mtshon pa tsam yin te /
translated: This is just an illustration.

original: dran pa dang ngo shes kyi shes pa dang / the tshom dang / nges pa dang / rang gi bcol ba len pa dang / mthong ba'i don la ngo mtshar dang bral ba dang / rgyu dang 'bras bu nyid dang de rtogs pa'i tshad ma dang /
analyzed: dran pa dang ngo shes kyi shes pa dang / the tshom dang / nges pa dang / rang gi bcol ba len pa dang / mthong ba'i don la ngo mtshar dang bral ba dang / rgyu dang 'bras bu nyid dang de rtogs pa'i tshad ma dang /
translated: And there would be no memory, recognition, doubt, certainty, taking back one‚Äôs own gifts, wonder at what one has seen, cause and effect, valid cognition,

original: bcings pa dang / thar pa la sogs pa dag tu yang mi 'gyur ro zhe na ste gal te de ltar 'dod na /
analyzed: bcings pa dang / thar pa la sogs pa dag tu yang mi 'gyur ro zhe na ste gal te de ltar 'dod na /
translated: and also no bondage, liberation, and so on.

original: de rigs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba /üîΩ'bras bzhi zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de rigs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba / 'bras bzhi zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: If you assert that, it is illogical.

original: khyod dang kho bo cag gnyis la ste /
analyzed: khyod dang kho bo cag gnyis la ste /
translated: The four effects and so on are established and ascertained for both you and us.

original: bdag tu smra ba khyed dang / bdag med par smra ba nged cag la grub cing nges pa yin no //
analyzed: bdag tu smra ba khyed dang / bdag med par smra ba nged cag la grub cing nges pa yin no //
translated: For you, the proponents of self, and for us, the proponents of selflessness.

original: ci zhig grub ce na /
analyzed: ci zhig grub ce na /
translated: What is established?

original: bya ba 'bras bu bzhi tha dad par gsungs te /
analyzed: bya ba 'bras bu bzhi tha dad par gsungs te /
translated: The four effects of action are taught to be different.

original: las ni bya ba yin te /
analyzed: las ni bya ba yin te /
translated: Action is the deed.

original: 'jig rten 'di la'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten 'di la'o //
translated: It is in this world.

original: 'jig rten pha rol du de'i 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten pha rol du de'i 'bras bu'o //
translated: Its effect is in the next world.

original: gzhi tha dad pa de dag la ste /
analyzed: gzhi tha dad pa de dag la ste /
translated: They are different bases.

original: rten sna tshogs de dag la grub po //
analyzed: rten sna tshogs de dag la grub po //
translated: They are established in those various supports.

original: 'di ltar yang lus ngag gis skye ba de nyid la las byed pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar yang lus ngag gis skye ba de nyid la las byed pa ni ma yin te /
translated: In this way, the body and speech of that very birth do not perform the action,

original: de nyid kyis 'jig rten pha rol du 'bras bu la longs spyod pa yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyis 'jig rten pha rol du 'bras bu la longs spyod pa yin no //
translated: but by that very action one experiences the effect in the next world.

original: de'i phyir las byed pa gzhan nyid yin la /
analyzed: de'i phyir las byed pa gzhan nyid yin la /
translated: Therefore, the performer of the action is one,

original: longs spyod pa po yang gzhan yin no //
analyzed: longs spyod pa po yang gzhan yin no //
translated: and the experiencer is another.

original: de lta bas na gzhi tha dad pa la bya ba dang 'bras bu dag tu 'gyur la 'di la yang 'u bu cag la rtsod pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na gzhi tha dad pa la bya ba dang 'bras bu dag tu 'gyur la 'di la yang 'u bu cag la rtsod pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Thus, action and effect are in different bases, and we do not dispute this.

original: de ltar gyur na yang bdag de'i bya ba med par de nyid byed pa po nyid dang / longs spyod pa po nyid dag tu mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar gyur na yang bdag de'i bya ba med par de nyid byed pa po nyid dang / longs spyod pa po nyid dag tu mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: Even if this were so, that self would not be the agent and experiencer without activity.

original: 'di la brjod pa der bdag byed pa med ces pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: 'di la brjod pa der bdag byed pa med ces pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: In response to this, Aryadeva says, ‚ÄúIf the self is inactive, etc.

original: byed pa med pa ni byed pa dang bral ba yin la /
analyzed: byed pa med pa ni byed pa dang bral ba yin la /
translated: ‚Äù Inactive means devoid of activity.

original: de la zhes pa ni las byed pa dang 'bras bu la longs spyod pa dag la'o //
analyzed: de la zhes pa ni las byed pa dang 'bras bu la longs spyod pa dag la'o //
translated: ‚Äú In that‚Äù refers to the performance of the action and the experience of the effect.

original: bdag byed pa med pa nyid ni sems pa med pa'i phyir dang / rtag pa'i phyir gang la yang byed pa la nus pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: bdag byed pa med pa nyid ni sems pa med pa'i phyir dang / rtag pa'i phyir gang la yang byed pa la nus pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: The self, which is devoid of activity, has no power to act, because it is without thought and because it is permanent.

original: gang yang brjod pa /
analyzed: gang yang brjod pa /
translated: And also, it is said:

original: shes pa tsam sogs gang 'brel pa //
analyzed: shes pa tsam sogs gang 'brel pa //
translated: That which is related to mere consciousness, etc.,

original: de @233b la byed pa po nyid brjod //
analyzed: de @233b la byed pa po nyid brjod //
translated: is called the agent.

original: bde dang sdug bsngal sogs rigs pa //
analyzed: bde dang sdug bsngal sogs rigs pa //
translated: The experiencer is logically related to pleasure, pain, etc.,

original: 'du ba las ni za ba po //
analyzed: 'du ba las ni za ba po //
translated: because of their association.

original: zhes so // de yang brjod pa'i rim pas snga ma dang phyi ma'i dus dag tu mi g-yo ba'i rang bzhin du rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: zhes so // de yang brjod pa'i rim pas snga ma dang phyi ma'i dus dag tu mi g-yo ba'i rang bzhin du rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: And that is not logical, because of the sequence of the statement, the former and latter times are not of the nature of the unmoving.
